description:
New Jumbo Seafood is located in the Outer Sunset area. If you are lucky, you can find a spot right in front of the restaurant on Noriega. Otherwise, be prepared to drive around the area. My family loves authentic Chinese food so we had to check out this place. 

We had a reservation for a party of 8 at 5:30PM on a Saturday. The restaurant was packed - there were a few tables hosting a social event so it was lively. Despite the restaurant being so busy, service was quick and they came to check our table often. The food was delicious! Some of the highlights are reviewed below. 

Yam and Wolfberries Turtle Soup 
* Very comforting on a cold day 

Yang Chow Fried Rice 
* Rice was not mushy or oily 
* It was packed with flavor from the dried scallop pieces

House Special Spare Rib w/ BBQ Sauce (my favorite) 
* Meat was tender and juicy 
* Sauce was delicious - sweet with a hint of soy sauce in every bite
* Leftover sauce was so flavorful with rice

Crab w/ Salty Egg Yolk (another favorite) - It was messy to eat but I was impressed by the flavor combination 
* It was salty but it didn't overpower the dish 
* Crab was slightly sweet and tasted very fresh 

Sauteed Lobster with Ginger and Scallion 
* Flavored nicely with ginger and meat was soft but still had a bite to it 
* Noodles on the bottom were a little too soft 

Famous Deep Fried Squab 
* Meat was so tender and juicy 
* Skin was golden brown and crunchy 

Overall, the food was great. However, I just want to mention that you should eat at your own risk - Yelp warns of a poor food safety score. 

Our bill was a little over $400 with tax and tips so that's about $50/ person.
author: Courtney H.

description:
This is quite scary to see this warning on Yelp. First time I saw it before. "This restaurant has failed to improve food safety" 

Ordered three dishes and they all came out at a decent time. Food seems quite safe, did not get a stomachs or food poisoning which is good. 

Our server was quite nice and told us the popular items. He refilled our tea quite often even though it was busy.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
When your fam and extended fam are all into only Chinese food, you gotta go with the flow and ignore the 2.5 stars on Yelp. 

New Jumbo has ended up as our go-to restaurant in Outer Sunset mainly for its authentic Cantonese dishes. Always make a reservation if you can but don't call during busy dining hours. They won't answer the phone. 

There are a ton of negative things that many other Yelpers have already pointed out. I would agree with most of them. However, I can tolerate the service (or lack thereof), flies, grease, and what have you if my fam is pleased with the food. 

While engaged in meaningful conversations with each other, my fam is surrounded by authentic dishes that revive old memories in China. After all, good food has the power to evoke old memories and create new ones. 

The dinner items we always get are: 
+Yam and Wolfberries Turtle Soup (pack the contents to make soup again at home the next day)
+Deep Fried Squab (Grandma's fav - she gets so excited over this dish)
+House Special Spareribs with BBQ Sauce (served still sizzling on special cookware - super tender)
+Crab with Salty Egg Yolk (salty but tasty - salty egg makes eating crab more worth the effort than usual)
+String Beans with Salted Fish (acquired taste dish)
+Pea Sprouts with Garlic (a bit greasy but it's still a veggie!)
author: Kim H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night and it was quite busy. Waited for almost an hour for a table of 4! The food is pretty good! The roasted squab was really good. Service was pretty quick and all of our dishes came out fast even though the place was packed. 

Asked for extra napkins and they gave an entire stack! Definitely love a Chinese restaurant who isn't stingy with their napkins!
author: Bonnie T.

description: I don't recommend this place, the food quality is bad and service is horrible. I order 4 items at the beginning and the food came up very greasy. I told the waiter and we decided to order another item vegetable mix. He promised me will less oil and MSG, but still very greasy. I told the owner the food is too greasy, she did not say anything and walked away. The attitude is not good. Bad restaurant. Never come back again.
author: Andy W.

description:
OK, its been a while since I last came here.  However, I heard that its much better than before, after being renovated, a while back. Got some recommendations from friends, as to whats good to eat.  So, here's what we ordered...

-Chicken and coconut soup 4/5
-Roasted pigeons 4/5
-Clams 4/5
-Pigs stomach, with yellow chicken and wasabi 4/5
-Sparibs 4/5
-some veg with fermented beancurd 5/5
-brocolini 3/5
-Lobster 3/5

Overall, a great homey place to eat. Some dishes were a little oily for my taste but acceptable. Lots of families and elderly people eating there.  Kinda loud, probably because it was Chinese New Year and there was a lot of drinking on the next table. Total bill including tax and tip was over $300 for 6 ppl. Parking can be challenging, unless you come early to find street parking.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Sanitation health food violations, for around maybe 3 months now. Beware! If you like sitting on the toilet, all day-be my guest.
author: Ken Y.

description:
More on the 3.5 stars.

My parents really wanted me to try the wasabi marinated pig stomach with chicken here, so there I went with the family! I arrived at about 1pm on the weekend and it was busy, but not packed. My family (4) were seated pretty quickly. I am told that from the time of 11am - 1pm, there is a steady flow of people going in and out, which I kind of saw. Pretty good indication to me that ingredients don't sit and some people actually like the food.

Upon seating, we were given the complimentary tea and Chinese soup, which was okay. Pretty basic and standard soup provided at a Chinese restaurant in SF. We ordered one squab (pigeon), steamed three-egg dish, wasabi marinated pig stomach with chicken (yellow - wong mo), house special spare rib, and stir-fry pea shoots with garlic.  

Squab: pretty dang good. Having had the Hong Kong squabs and my parents' praise, their squab is pretty similar to the HK squabs. Tastes very similar, but just a notch below in that the squab itself wasn't as moist and juicy. But that can't be helped if it's an ingredient issue. Nice that they provided the 5-spice salt with the squab too (as it should come with).

Steamed three-egg: We simply just wanted to try it and it isn't bad, but as expected, a bit lacking. The three eggs are salted egg, regular egg, and preserved duck egg (century egg). The egg batter wasn't whisked enough, because when you spoon the egg upside down into your bowl, you can see the egg white and yellows are still separated, and not uniform. You can't see it on the top, because soy sauce was used to mask it. There was also very little salted egg and preserved duck egg, but that's expected. The egg batter was steamed pretty well as it was very smooth and silky, but given the thickness of the dish, I would certainly hope they can steam it well.

House special spare ribs: Again, simply wanted to try it. My family aren't a huge fan, but it was worth a try. The sparerib comes out in a special bake ware and smells great. The sauce isn't the American BBQ sauce, but it's the Chinese BBQ sauce where yellow sugar, soy sauce, and dark soy sauce (and some other sauce) is mixed. The spare ribs were most likely fried and then re-baked with the sauce. Quite tender and there wasn't a thick layer or fried batter/flour. 

Wasabi marinated pork stomach with yellow chicken: My goodness. First off, the pig stomach and chicken were great in that the presentation looks amazing. The only downside was that the wasabi was too strong and my family can eat wasabi. Our sinuses were cleared and we definitely had a few more coughs than we should have during the meal. Aside from that, the pig stomach had a crunchy bite (some pieces did and some didn't), didn't have the foul pig stomach smell, and the chicken mixed well with the wasabi marinate with the pig stomach. The dish overall was nice to eat - just minus the overly strong wasabi. It's funny, because when we asked the server if the wasabi is mixed when ordered, and he said yes. We said it was a bit too strong and to let the chef know for next time, and he said to just let the dish sit and let the wasabi disperse. (Laugh!)

Stir-fry snow shoots with garlic: Basic stir-fry vegetable dish and they did it pretty decently. The garlic wasn't minced, but it was pan-fried and used to stir-fry with the snow shoots. Came out steaming hot and didn't taste 'old'. Pretty solid stir-fry for this dish.

Overall, I did like the food and wouldn't mind coming back again for the wasabi marinated pig intestine with chicken and squab. I think this place is worth a try and depending on what you order, you can be surprised. 

Side notes: Looked like a lot of local workers tend to come en masse to enjoy a meal together. Even on the weekend, we noticed some Asian construction workers eating a meal together at one of the large round tables. On another note, the restaurant does appear to be understaffed. Last note, they do charge rice.
author: Alex W.

description: I want to put zero star if I can. Trouble service！tiny table！Bad attitude! The old lady who work on the cashier is so mean. She always use cuz word in Chinese. Feel too bad to eat in here!
author: Danping Y.

description:
Quality of food is eh here. Came here for dinner here tonight because a family relative recommended us try come for their fried squab. 

Environment: 
Very spacious and lots of seating. There are many tables in the restaurant with comfortable chairs. I actually really enjoyed the dining space inside--table cloth and the set-up reminded me of a higher end banquet-style restaurant. However, I felt slightly uncomfortable because of the attentiveness of the staff. There were several staff that were standing in the back watching intently at those that walked in. Not sure why they were so alert. We arrived at 6:00pm and less than half of the restaurant was filled.

Food:
Overall, not really pleased with the food. Food is generally pretty good, but needs work in terms of seasoning and flavoring.

-Braised Lamb w/ Mushroom (2/5): Upon first glance, the clay-pot dish looked very fancy. I was quite excited since I really like lamb. After taking a bite of the lamb, I was disappointed that all I could taste were flavors of salt and ginger. Tofu skin was dry. The lamb was very tough as well. Not very flavorful.

-Chicken and Salted Fish Fried Rice (4.5/5): YUM! This one was definitely a standout. I am a big fan of salted fish fried rice, so when I saw this on the menu, I was certain I wanted to order this. Exactly how I wanted it to taste--not too oily or dry! The only reason why I didn't give it a 5/5 was because the fish was very OVERLY salty. Otherwise, it would've been perf!

-Ribeye Steak w/ Mixed Mushroom (3.5/5): Ribeye steak was extremely tender. The dish was filled with flavors of garlic and sweet soy sauce; really delicious sauce and the mushrooms were delicious! This dish was also salty (more than the braised lamb w/ mushroom). 

-Clams w/ Black Bean Sauce (3/5): Not a big fan of black bean sauce, but the sauce was pretty good. The clams were very watery and tasted bland. Flavors of the sauce didn't seem to have seasoned the clams very well. The only good part was the bell peppers and onions.

-Deep Fried Squab (4/5): Must-try! Tender and soooooo juicy! The flavors of the squab were delicious. The skin of the squab was the best part--super crunchy and so satisfying. 

Service: 
When we walked into the restaurant, our waiter didn't even greet us. He was on the phone and made us wait several minutes. When my dad suggested that the lamb be cooked longer because it was really tough, our waiter said that other customers like it just the way it is and questioned his thoughts. Food arrived fairly slowly too. 

Last Thoughts:
Overall, I thought the food was alright. There are definitely better Cantonese restaurants than this one. Low marks of the night were that the dishes (ribeye steak, braised lamb, and fish from the fried rice) seemed all-around really salty. Don't think I would come back again.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Only went here because dim sum next door was too busy and we didn't want to wait. We ordered their shanghai chow mein and their squab. Our meal came with a huge bowl of complimentary soup in which I found a dead fly in after drinking most of what was in my bowl. I brought this to the attention of one of the waiters and they didn't even apologize for the fly in our meal, but simply just took the bowl away. I won't ever be back.
author: Sydney C.

description:
Foods alright, not spectacular, but not bad. They have a few dishes that i really enjoy, like the roasted squab, but everything else was just fine. Price point is typical for Chinese food, it really depends on what you order. A single dish could run you anywhere from $12 and up.

The service is a bit whack. Seems pretty understaffed. Why do they have reservations when they clearly don't abide by them? It took several calls to even get through to make the reservation. Had a reservation for 7:30PM, but we weren't acknowledged until 8:15PM. And when we did finally get served, the waitresses and hostess were pretty rude.
author: Eva C.

description:
Great food in this gourmet restaurant :
Service excellent food comes out hot and fresh from chef wok.  
Tasty on most of dish just a heavy on salt. No BBQ duck that sets in 3 stars rating!!!
Desert Medley mixed red beans syrups! YUM!!!
Seatings are little tidy. 
Street Parking only .
author: Kitty C.

description:
So I'll agree with some points that have been previously made:

1. Maximum capacity? Yeah. Not really adhered to. It's more about maxing profits. Our table was literally backed into another table with very little room to maneuver around.

2. Customer service is totally not existent. Aside from the lady up front, all the other waitstaff are pretty incompetant. It takes a lot of effort to flag one down because they are tunnel visioned on turning tables as fast as humanly possible.

But where these two points raise a few red flags, I do have to say that since their remodel...their food is generally back to being top notch.

My favorite dishes of the night where the green beans with salted fish and ground pork and spareribs. The green beans, despite being chopped to bite size, were still crisp and fresh. Flavors were pretty strong from the salted fish and from the chili oil, but my brother and I basically competed for this dish opting for thirds....fourths even. Second favorite were the house spareribs. The meat was crisp yet tender and tossed in the most delicious honey, garlic, soy reduction! 

Another standout of the night was the fried rice. It wasn't too oily or dry and was tossed with just enough snow peas and dried scallop to really accentuate the flavor and textures.

As for the rest of our dishes, we thought they were all still good. The pork neck was incredibly juicy and tender and the shrimp was clean but difficult to eat with a honey based coating and shell on. The low marks of the night included the flounder which was deep fried a bit too much and the ginger chicken clay pot which had too many bones imo.

All in all, very consistent meal from Jumbo!
author: Elaine Y.

description: I came here on a Saturday, the portion are decent. You can say there is an authentic Asian feel. But the servers were not th best, they didn't really acknowledge you, I don't know if cuz it's the weekend. The salted fried rice didn't have that fermented scent that other restaurant have. But they did have this one dish that was nice but a small portion. The foiled rib eye or pork rib was delicious.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
I haven't even eaten here yet since the wait is so terribly long. I hate it already!

The food is not atrocious but the service is!
author: Victoria P.

description: Tried their wasabi chicken and its really good.  But their chicken are not shredded like some place . These are whole pieces of chicken.  Still good. But I prefer shredded . Overall food here is pretty  good
author: G C.

description:
WE WERE 5 of family  Wait around half hour When our term came A group people dropped in Not Book table n said 鄉理 got the table immediately WHEN WE ASKED REASON IS SAME VILLAGE鄉理REALLY LOUSY ANDWER 
We left unhappily Why they post 鄉理優先No score We did not try the food
author: May Y.

description:
Really do not understand why this place got so low on rating!
You have to come over and try the food by yourself! The food is great and price is reasonable, of course, service is bad as all the Chinese restaurants.
Very traditional dishes, love it. But do not expect service though!
author: Mm J.

description:
Don't be fooled by the low rating, the food here is actually pretty good!

My coworker highly recommended this Cantonese spot to me recently after he discovered it himself, so despite the low rating i decided to give it a shot one Friday night with three other friends.

We arrived a little before 7, and waited about 40 minutes for our table. Yes our table was super cramped and it felt like there was very little room to walk, but I took it all in stride as I don't expect too much from Chinese restaurants. 

Their menu was interesting to look at...they have sections like "Good Food", "Preferred Dishes", and "Chef's Specialties". Luckily we came prepared. My coworker recommended we get the fried squab as well as the spare ribs (there were mulitple pork rib dishes but the popular one is the house special spare ribs in bbq sauce), so we ordered those two dishes along with beef chow fun and a veggie dish. They were all pretty good picks, especially the spare ribs! 

The squab meat was very tender and flavorful, though ultimately a little harder to eat because of all the bones. The spare ribs were soft and juicy and also had really good flavor. I couldn't pinpoint what flavors went into the sauce, but it was the perfect blend of sweet and savory (a combo that I usually don't like that much). My friends spooned all the extra sauce from the spare ribs into their bowls to eat with the rice, it was that good! The beef chow fun was pretty standard, a little on the bland side but that's not a bad thing to have less sodium in your food. There was also complimentary red bean soup for dessert after we finished our meal.

Food came out very quickly after we ordered, and service was decent; we didn't have too much trouble flagging the servers down for stuff. 

And our meal was SO cheap too, only $15 pp after tax and tip. I really need to start eating out 
at Chinese restaurants more often!

Parking was a little bit difficult on a Friday night as the restaurant is in a busy area of Noriega. All of the metered spots around the restaurant were full, but I got lucky with a residential spot 3-4 blocks away.

As we were walking to our table, almost every table we walked by had ordered some kind of crab or seafood dish (makes sense, given the name of the restaurant and the fact that crabs are in season), so next time I definitely want to order some of that yummy crab as well!
author: Dianna H.

description:
Y'all, according to the Chinese fam, this is the spot to be for some legit Chinese food. Maybe for all the unique, authentic/traditional dishes that is. But IMO, I dislike this place for several reasons. 

1. Maybe it's the other customers, maybe it's the restaurant...but either way, there are too many damn ppl in this little place. I'm PRETTY sure that the limited amount of walking space up in here is a fire hazard. AND the other customers get REAL, REAL aggressive in the TINY little waiting area up in front (that should be for 5ish ppl but 25 ppl try to jam themselves into). People have no chill here. At all. 

My family was seated in the large table near the front window tonight for a party of 13. Since it's their biggest table in the restaurant, we had to be seated there. The worst part is that that table is RIGHT next to the TINY waiting area. My cousins hubby got elbowed by one person, smacked by a purse from another, andddd one lady literally leaned so far back onto him that her hair was on his head. WTF. PERSONAL space is not a real thing apparently. 

2. The waitstaff here literally hate their lives. For the amount of ppl in this restaurant, the waitstaff to customers ratio is completely disproportionate. Do not bother asking for water, napkins, missing food (this has happened every time I've been here), or anything beyond your order, bc they really dgaf. I'm usually less opinionated about Chinese restaurants service if good food balances it out, but this place has got some of the absolute rudest service I've ever seen and not good enough food to justify the rudeness level. My aunt had to tell one waiter to be a nicer human being bc that was how much attitude he had.

3. Bc the fam likes this spot SO much, I sometimes have to just sit thru the meals here even though I'd much rather be somewhere else. Anywhere else. TWO times I've found foreign objects in my food. Once was a staple in my veggies?! that I could've choked on. So disgusting. Another time was hair in my noodles. So gross. Some of these visits were followed by stomach aches (not surprising). 

TBH, the quality of food here (that I've had), the lack of service level (which I typically forgive if the food is good, but it's not worth it here), makes me barely able to give them 2 stars.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I would give out no star to this restaurant. No service, bad attitude. Might be too busy so they don't care about people just walk in.
author: Carol T.

description: This is a true gem.  The restaurant is small but the seating is fair,  first come first serve.  They will even seat small party to their big table. Contrary to what  I read,  we received good service. Efficient.  The food is really good. Definitely one of the best in the bay area.  No wonder this place is busy all the time.
author: Kit L.

description: You can't bet the quality of authentic Chinese food. New Jumbo presents the heart of China in all their dishes. A bit pricey, but definitely with it.
author: Mike C.

description:
First off dinner was delicious.  I love their crispy squab; sea coconut with Chinese herb and stew chicken soup; honey spare ribs; and many more.  This is the type of restaurant for family dinner ( because you can order a variety of different dishes)
Staffs were very efficient, you can tell they are very experienced. There's a gentleman he seems to be a senior staff he is very attentive and I had only wished I knew his name to properly recognize his services. 
My chief complaints are the place is Super NOISY and the seating is very Cramped, you can barely get out of your table without bumping the guy behind or in front of you. Trust me this place will not pass the Fire Code if and when the fire inspector do come in especially during dinner time 

I would have rated this place a 4 star but have to take down a notch because of the seating and noise level. Food is delicious
author: P C.

description: Self: don't come here anymore... they have the standard 3 entrees + soup and rice meal but it's $25.99 and there weren't too many tasty choices. Don't be a sucker for the fried garlic chicken wings -- sounds Korean inspired but not even close and tasted just like regular Chinese fried chicken wings. Curry chicken had slivers of chicken breast, though the sauce itself was tasty. Salt and pepper spareribs didn't have much seasoning. Overall portions seemed smaller than many years ago when I used to come here. Total bill was $29.95
author: Cathrin P C.

description: I love their house special ribs! The sauce they use for it makes the dish super savory, juicy, and overall delicious! Their other salt & pepper ribs and salt & pepper wings are pretty good as well. The place itself may be a bit cramped for seating, but totally worth it for the food!
author: Victoria T.

description:
Don't be fooled by the crowded restaurant and the amount of people waiting at the front door for a table! I recently came with the family for dinner. Do make reservations ahead of time if you know you plan to eat here. We had reservations at 5:30 p.m. and the restaurant was already pretty full. 

People seem to rave about their fried squab (because it's cheaper here than other places) and baked spare ribs. Sure, the squab wasn't dry like most places, but it wasn't something I would come back for either. The baked spare ribs were decent and probably the best thing we ordered for dinner. 

We also ordered the fried sticky rice (skip - it was greasy), fried oysters (skip), vegetable/mushroom/tofu dish (it was okay), yi mein (skip - it was greasy), and another dish which I can't think of. 

Parking is always hard to find in this area. If you're lucky, you'll be able to find street parking a block away. Service here is pretty standard for most of the Chinese restaurants I've been to in the Sunset. Overall, I'd pass here for dinner. There are better options out in the Richmond.
author: Steph F.

description: Eat at this place every others week, food is more of home cooking, nothing special and the prices is right, services okay for most customers, but for us is always good due to we are regular.
author: Bill W.

description: Overall, the food is fine. Just a bit too oily to me. The fried squab has the taste as it deserves from its rating. As for the environment, there are plenty of big tables for large groups of people, however, sometimes just have to wait for a long while.
author: Joe C.

description:
I been here a few times in the past couple of years and I came here twice for the past two months for family gatherings. This is the type of Chinese restaurants with authentic Chinese dinner dishes and crowded seating.

Food - I enjoy the food here and the dinner sets. The recent two times I came here, we had different sets of food. The most popular dish here is the baked spare ribs with special sauce (I don't know what the actual name of the dish is). The dish is wrapped around foil when the waiter brings it to you and it is burning hot.Each piece of the spareribs are big. If you have a big party, I recommend you order two of this. The quail here is also pretty good. I am never a really big fan of quail since it is usually dry. However, the quail here is perfectly moist and the skin has the perfect crisp. A few other dishes I like here are eggplants with beef, steamed fish, and fried rice.

Some dishes may be drenched in oil. I usually really like lobster but the lobster here was too oily and cancels out the taste of the fresh lobster. The vegetables )such as the green mustard with mushroom dish) are drowned in oil as well.

For dessert, each person gets a bowl of red bean soup!


Service - Understaffed, however the servers would assist you as fast as they could if they are able to. Nothing special with the service.

Ambiance - Extremely crowded and you would be elbow to elbow if you come here with a big party. 


Overall, I would come here for big family gatherings for the dinner sets but I don't think I will come here with a small party. The food here is pretty good but some dishes are a hit or miss.
author: Allie Y.

description:
This is one of my relatives favorite places and I came here last night with them. We ordered a variety of dishes and the highlights were a sweet fried pork dish, black pepper beef and squab wasn't too bad. 

I wasn't a fan of the green beans, steamed fish (did not look like 2 lbs) and king mushroom with pork?. 

It was somewhat better than my dinner at the next restaurant on the next day, Dragon Beaux because I could at least understand what was on the plate.
author: Lily Z.

description: We came here for dinner and the owner is pressuring us to order 20 dishes for 7 people. She wouldn't leave our table and process the order until we chose more dishes. We already chose 12 dishes and a double soup. I hope we don't get food poisoning from eating here. Wish us luck.
author: gordon g.

description:
Came around 6:30 for a table of 5 and did not get seated until 8pm, there were four other tables that came after us that got seated before us - we were basically the last ones seated. Customer service here is bad - everyone was either rude or slow to respond. If you want to have a pleasant dinner with your family, I would most definitely turn to somewhere else.

Update: the food is pretty good, but my previous comments on the service and the wait still stands.
author: Donna Y.

description:
Don't be fooled by the low ratings. This is one of the best Chinese restaurants in the city. My family comes here all the time for special occasions. 

Make a reservation because it's super difficult to find seating during dinner time. 

Definitely need to try the delicious squab and house special bbq spareribs! These two dishes are a must when my family comes here
author: Megan C.

description:
Had dinner in 95 degree weather. Food was great a bit oily. Waiters had poor skills. Horrible customer service experience. Tried to flag them down and they act like they don't see you .Asked for water but didn't acknowledge it.
Otherwise typical joint.
author: Meishi M.

description: The food here is extremely greasy and bland the service here is terrible and I would not recommend coming here.
author: Southwest767 7.

description: This is a terrible place. The service is horrible. I came here with my family for a dinner and it was for a party of six. My mother and my brother came in with me. They had literally JUST OPENED. Actually, I take that back. They opened 8 minutes early and I came in. The restaurant had only 2 tables filled. The rest was empty. I ask for 6 seats and they say "alright take a number" and "I'll only seat you when your entire party is here". This was very ridiculous because there were SO many tables EMPTY. My mother was outraged. They were very rude and didn't seat us despite having empty tables. When we finally walked out on them, they finally said we could sit. I'll be honest, it takes about an hour for you to get food at this place.
author: Morgan N.

description:
This place is ridiculous. Came yesterday just before 5pm for a party of 6. The place had about 3 tables occupied while the rest of the restaurant was empty. The boss lady demanded that we had everyone present before sitting us down. 4 out of 6 of us were here. Yet she refused to sit us. All this time counting her receipts and not having any eye contact. I told her that we can order immediately so as to not waste their time and space. She still said no. Then a party of two came and she sat them down immediately without asking if the second person was here. RUDE. 
I thought about giving this place another try since they first opened. The first experience was not that good as well. The wait for the food to arrive was pathetic. I don't think anything has changed. This restaurant is not worth going to.
author: K N.

description: I used to like this restaurant because it serves authentic Chinese food, but lately I had a few bad experiences that I will no longer go back: 1) the owner/the lady who collects $ is very rude most of the time 2) they change their pricing based on demand, not on their cost. For example, their crab is usually about $37 but they raised it to over $53 during Chinese new year. The price for the same dish varied for over $15 in one month! To me, that is just pure greed 3) I ordered a duck egg crab today and it came out to be stinky. I had only a couple bites and complained it to the owner/the lady in the kitchen because I didn't want to make a scene. I told her I have ordered this duck egg crab many times in the past and I am 100% certain today's crab or the duck egg was not fresh. I have a sensitive stomach and I could get violently sick if I had some bad seafood. The owner/the lady became defensive, rude, and physically violent (she accidentally hit my hand with her big gestures), and refused to let me return the dish. Then they chef (a tall guy) came out and yelled at me. They both tried to intimidate me and created a huge scene. While I was in the kitchen talking to them about the crab, I also noticed that their kitchen is filthy. I wonder if they have passed the health inspection. Anyways, I will never go back there again.
author: A L.

description:
I came here with a party of 5 on a Sunday evening. Worst mistake ever. 
CONS:
1.) I'm pretty sure the maximum amount of people in the room (99) was exceeded. This posed a safety hazard.
2.) The room was cramed. The people waiting to be seated were hovering over the families having dinner. I would've have felt uncomfortable. 
3.) Some of the waitresses were extremely rude. The host pushed me because I was in her way. She should've have said excuse me.
4.) The table cloth was dirty, which made me wonder if anything else was cleaned. 
5.) The food was drenched in oil. Every time I wiped my mouth, the oil left an imprint.
6.) The waitress clumsily knocked over our tea and onto my friend's phone. 
7.) The service was dysfunctional.

PROS:
1.) One of the waitresses gave us extra dessert to take home.
2.) Food arrived in a good time

If you're in the neighborhood, I do not recommend this place.
author: Vanessa Y.

description: I HAVE NEVER BEEN SO DISAPPOINTED IN CHINESE FOOD. I am a chinese vietnamese american growing up eating chinese and viet food, at home, in resturants, everywhere. This reaturant is just horrible, it is extremely crowded, customer service is complete crap, and the food is barely decent. We ordered the salt and pepper fried squid, shrimp in mayo sauce with walnuts, and the black bean sauce clams. It was the most disgusting seafood I've ever tasted. The squid barely had any salt in it, the shrimp was the worst, and the clams were cold and watered down. IT IS NOT FRESH AND THEY ARE KNOWN FOR SEAFOOD. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT. The salted fish fried rice wasnt flavorful, the only thing that had flavor was the salted fish.The only thing we ordered that tasted good was the pigeon, but other than that, it was disappointing like ratings say. I gave it a try and ignored the ratings, but it turns out that it is horrible. Will never be back.
author: Vicki V.

description: Enjoyed our deliciously prepared meal. We ordered the fried flounder fish- perfectly done,beef rib eye with mushroom, Shanghai chicken noodles and chicken and corn soup and chicken fried rice. The best, can't wait to come back again. Also, good service.
author: Brenda V.

description: This is my family's go to Chinese restaurant, not sure why they have such low reviews, but their food is delicious. We usually get the fried squab, which is juicy unlike most other restaurants, the house special spare ribs and giant clam with garlic and vermicelli. They're not known for customer service, but what Chinese restaurant really is. Even with such low Yelp stars, they're always busy, so that really says something.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Food are okay and not overpriced. Service is terrible. We ordered soup noodle and fried rice. I ask for bowl. The waitress dropped off 2 bowls and walked away but I have 3 people sitting in the table. When she came back, I asked for 1 more bowl. She looked at me and walked away. She never bring me the third bowl I asked for. I also ordered a seafood soup noodle to go. The same waitress brought in the order which is already packed in container. When I get home, it was a ginger chicken noodle with a container of clear broth.
author: Elisa C.

description:
We came here for a real late lunch with a number of relatives, right after funeral services for my grandpa.  The multi-course menu had some okay dishes, with a few that really stood out.

The most outstanding dish was their steamed black bass, with the classic ginger-scallion soy sauce.  Fish meat was cooked perfectly, and the sauce was really good - not too salty, just right.  

The honey walnut prawns were just okay; there were a few gooey pieces from excessive breading.  

Meats (roast pork belly, steamed chicken with minced ginger) were a tad bit on the dry side, and not as juicy as other places.

The restaurant has just two bathroom stalls (unisex). As for parking, there's meters out front with 1-hr limits and more meters two blocks away with 2-hr limits.
author: Daniel C.

description:
We've come here numerous times, due to the fact that my fiance's family loves this place.  I must admit it's a great deal for lunch, for $23 you get 3 big entrees and it definitely feeds 4 people, perhaps even 5.

This time around we got the pigeon ($9.99 excluded from lunch deal), spare ribs with potato curry, chicken with salted fish and tofu clay pot, sliced fish and vegetables.

I personally really liked the spare ribs with potato curry, definitely one of my favorite entree.

Overall this place has a great price point especially for lunch , a little heavy on msg which once in a while I don't really mind, service is below average however for the price can you really complain ? 
In my opinion the cost to food quality is not bad, not a fancy restaurant by any means, but great place if you're with a people and don't want to spend too much.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Horrible service.  We went to the restaurant right when it opened. Waited 20 min was unable to order.  The waiter did not acknowledge us but rather serve other individuals that spoke Chinese.  Worst service I've ever had.
author: Arvin W.

description: Worst restaurant in the city,food is tasteless and greasy..we ordered four giant clams,one of them is rotten...so disgusting...I don't recommend this place at all..I didn't expect this crap after the long wait
author: Wen Y.

description: 1 star for not letting us in at 2:30 when hours clearly state they close at 3PM. I asked for table for two and a waitress was about to seat us. Next thing you know this waiter comes out and said they're closed. I told them no you're not, it's no even 3:00 yet. We hauled butt to come try their restaurant out, but I guess they don't want business. Word of mouth is really important.  Jumbo Seafood Restaurant, you failed. You won't be getting business from me or my people.
author: Irene C.

description:
We came here for my aunt's birthday celebration.  Our party arrived at 5:30 for the celebration and we consisted of four banquet tables of ten. We had the first sitting and we had to be out of the restaurant by 7:30 for the next sitting. 

Our banquet meal consisted of:
House Special Appetizers 
Deep Fried Squab
Stir Fried Shrimp with Scallops over Vegetables
Treasure Bowl
Abalone with Sea Cucumber with Fish Maw Soup
House Special Chicken
House Special Lobster
Steamed Live Fresh Fish
Longevity Noodles
Stir Fried Glutinous Rice
Dessert - Red bean tapioca


The food in most part was good, but nothing stood out.

The restaurant was full of patrons and very busy as there were multiple banquet tables aside from ours. The problem with this is that some course come out pretty fast, in that you don't get a chance to fully enjoy the course at hand. And before you know it the next course comes out. It's like a production line meal.  So it's a busy, hectic and noisy atmosphere.  If you're use to attending these types of banquets, it's in most part the norm.
author: Al L.

description:
We had dinner at New Jumbo Seafood restaurant on Noriega 2 weeks ago and thought the food was fairly delicious, and the portion was rather decent. However, customer service could be better. 

Yesterday (Nov 21), we entered the restaurant at 2:36 pm; the mid-age waiter at the cash register told us they were closed because the "staff lunch" was ready for them. We said the restaurant stops serving lunch at 3 pm; it's only 2:35 pm. The waiter showed no emotion nor provided additional explanation but continued counting the cash at the cash register. The management should update the new business hour on the door and the website OR tell the waiter(s) to seat all customers if they are there before 3 pm.

For the food, I give it a 3 star. 
For customer service, I give it less than 2.
author: Lisa C.

description: Owner lady is *mind my language* rude ASF. She is arrogant and an uncultured swine. When choosing a restaurant, please choose a respectable place and don't support a restaurant that has NO RESPECT FOR THEIR PAYING CUSTOMERS.
author: Shelly T.

description:
I was planning to have dinner with my friends here last night. We got here at 5:20pm, 20 minutes after they opened for dinner. There were plenty of tables available but they refused to seat us because they were all reserved for 6pm and later.  The hostess refused to put us on the wait list. She said if we waited, it will be end of day before we got seated. She was so rude!!  She started writing another party on the wait list, but I had to argue with her that I was there first. So she finally put us down and with an attitude, she told me that the table won't be ready until 7:30.
The waiting area is small and crowded. We didn't stay, just went to restaurant next door.
author: Jeannie S.

description:
This place is the most authentic Cantonese seafood restaurant I have been to in SF

The fried squab is highly recommended. It definitely tastes better than other places. The squab here is actually juicy (other places have really dried squabs) 

House spare ribs is definitely a must get. When you go inside the restaurant, you literally see this dish on every table.

Sea cucumber is definitely something that most people wouldn't get but I also recommend it because it's texture is very easy to chew.

Their house special soup is a must get as well. They  put literally a lot of stuff to make the soup. You can also eat the chicken that they put inside

Honestly I don't expect good service from a Chinese restaurant. People line up and wait for a table every night at this place for a reason. Btw this is my fifth coming back and even though I have to wait every now and then, I will still come back.
author: Imma K.

description: This restaurant is the worst Chinese restaurant in the Bay Area. Never give good customer service. They just gave good service to those customers who they know for long time. And the owner was so rude to people who was waiting for their table. If you don't have enough people, she won't allowed you get the table until all people are here.
author: Ja W.

description:
Came here for dinner and we ordered the following:

-Crab Meat w/Fish Maw Soup (Just OK)
-Deep fried Squab (Good)
-House Special Spareribs w/BBQ Sauce (Good)
-Pea Sprouts w/Garlic (Good)
-Pan fried whole Flounder w/Soy Sauce (OK)

*Friendly service
author: Wendy L.

description: Horrible service. The servers were rude and blamed us when they took our order wrong and still wanted to serve it to us.  All of them had an extremely bad attitude. Would not recommend if you want to be treated with respect.
author: Rachel Y.

description:
BOOOOOOOOOOOOO.

My mom's been raving about this place since she went with my aunts so I've been down to go for quite a while now. We decided to go here tonight for dinner so we couldn't really think of any other options and I wanted to see what all the rave was about. 

This restaurant is located on Noriega St. and parking is all on the streets. It's a pretty big sized restaurant in my opinion with a good number of small tables and large tables. Bathroom is located all the way in the back. 

My family and I got here around 6pm and thank god we did 'cause a line started forming after we were seated. The restaurant was pretty clean and the menu had a load of options to choose from so I was pretty excited about the food here. Yelp recommends the squab and the spare ribs so I got both of those and we also got string beans and cold pork stomach. They have a lot of items listed as "house special" which makes you think it's gonna be great except it's probably a lie. 

The spare ribs are good except until they get cold and it gets super oily. Cold pork stomach didn't have much flavor to it and the string beans were okay, but not insanely flavorful. The only thing I could probably recommend to you is the squab. They don't give you big cuts, but the skin was crunchy and it's good when it's dipped in some salt. 

My biggest problem was the service. Now I read on the tips section that service here isn't really all that, but I didn't think much of it because I believe that everyone has off days. Unfortunately, I guess I was just being too nice. We had already gotten our dishes when my mom asked a waiter if she could add one more dish and the waiter actually had the balls to say no because they were too busy. I get that there's people waiting for a table, but I've never actually heard of a waiter rejecting a customer. Like, wtf. Okay, fine. And then when we were packing up our leftovers, we had a wet dish so my dad asked for a plastic container instead of the paper one, but the lady boss told him "no, it'll work just fine." Uhm, rude. 

Overall, food wasn't all that and service sucked. Sorry, mom, but I don't want to come back here.
author: Venus L.

description:
don't come here if you're expecting customer service. and their menu is such a eyesore the way they have their dishes categorized. 

they overpacked this place and it gets so crowded. their food is average in terms of taste and portion. why the one star? 

they refused to give us the left over steamed rice that we PAID for to take home. I have never heard of such a thing. it brought me back to the time when I was on vacation in China and I see the restaurant worker dumping the uneaten rice back into the rice cooker for the next customers. that's disgusting and a health violation! But they don't have the same food regulation in China so anyways, I hope that is not what this restaurant does with the customers' left over rice. when we asked them why we couldn't pack it to take with us and what are they going to do with it, they said they throw it away. I call BS. I will put money on it that they are reusing it, whether it is for their fried rice or I hope to God it is not back to rice cooker like the incident in China. 

Never ever coming back here again. I refuse to patron shady business tactics like that which can pose a health threat to customers.
author: Jules L.

description:
Beware! This place is a disaster.  Unbelievably terrible customer service and overpriced menu.  Got a lot of unnecessary attitude when I asked to box up some leftovers to take home.  Pot stickers tasted strangely sour and ended up with horrible stomach problems soon after I got home.  Most importantly, saw some "critters" running around the floor which obviously warranted a complaint to the health dept.

Parking is also a disaster...while waiting 45min to be seated, had to deal with the smokefest right outside the entrance and witnessed two patrons get into a fight because one hit the other's car while backing out of the red zone in which they were both parked illegally.  Felt bad for the guy next door who was trying to leave but couldn't because he was blocked in due to the prolonged scuffle.  Seriously makes you wonder why people are waiting out the door in droves to eat here.  Anyone seeking an "authentic" Chinese food experience will pay a hefty price.
author: Carter Y.

description: I understand if you're busy and wanting to get to every customer but this place is plain rude. The maximum capacity in this room is "99" but i swear when I was in there, it was over 99. We had to wait about 30-45 minutes for a table of five. Three other groups got to sit down before us because the two tables were for fours. Good thing we waited a little longer because we were able to get a table with extra space. The only downside is that the tables weren't fully cleaned as the tablecloths still has food/stains & oils on it. I mean I get that you're rushing but there's so many workers that makes no sense. Another thing I noticed was that they shoo you away after you're done eating like let them take a damn breath lol. The food came in pretty quick tho but the food is a little less than average. I don't understand why people line up and wait so long when the food isn't even good, service ain't good, and an overcrowded restaurant. At the end they do provide desert like usual Chinese restaurants do. The lady was nice enough to give me more bowls of it since I asked and was super generous about it so plus one star for her. Overall it was an ehh experience and I don't know, I would come back in a few years probably.
author: Lisa W.

description:
STAY AWAY FROM THIS RESTAURANT AND ITS SHADY OWNER. KEEP IN MIND 15% OF YOUR BILL IS AUTOMATICALLY DEDUCTED FOR TIPS.
The only reason this restaurant could have possibly acquired 3 stars is because their food is barely passable; although still overpriced, greasy and served in small portions. The worst part about the restaurant; however, is the stingy owner. She probably has the worst attitude that I've ever seen from a restaurant owner, as she often rudely refuses customers if they don't have a reservation. She also treats her employees poorly, and I'm fairly certain she keeps all of the tips. KEEP IN MIND SHE AUTOMATICALLY DEDUCTS 15% OF YOUR BILL FOR TIPS. The worst part is if you pay with card, the owner fills in the (always 15%) tip and total amount before handing you the receipt to sign. She also rounds up the total amount to the nearest dollar amount. So if your subtotal comes to $75.50 and the (automatically deducted 15%) tip is $11.33, the stingy owner will write your total amount as $87 instead of $86.83, along with other questionable additions to the receipt (your orders aren't listed so you can't tell if it's totaled up correctly).
STAY AWAY FROM THIS RESTAURANT AND ITS SHADY OWNER.
author: Derika L.

description: Love the food!!  Authentic Chinese food that is delicious!  Will definitely come back again!  A family owned restaurant with fast service and amazing yummy food!
author: Liza J.

description: It's a Cantonese-style cuisine. Their food is good; though not the best I ever had during my visit to San Francisco. The service is so-so. The dining room is small and all the tables are placed close together. There is a full house when I came in with a large party and it is uncomfortable to be seated within 6 inches behind a stranger. Even more uncomfortable if you need to get out. Not for someone who is claustrophobic.
author: David T.

description: I don't know why people like this place. Bad services. May be because they are too busy the waiters/waitresses unable to provide needed service. Food is okay. I prefer the restaurant next door. Lower price and better service.
author: Judy C.

description: First, The food is OK.....,but Customer Service is really bad. They have really bad attitude. They think the business is so good that they don't even care services. Never go back to this place. There are so many good restaurants in sunset district....
author: Wendy J.

description:
It is under new management and new chef! With all these changes, this place is AWESOME! Finally a decent chinese restaurant in the Sunset that will accommodate big groups and is affordable! 

The squab is really remarkable. It's super affordable, about $10 for one squab that's cut into four pieces. It's a soy sauce dipped squab. Full of flavor and not dry at all. 

The pork ribs with onions (I don't know the name) is also really good. It seems to be popular with a lot of guests as we saw it at nearly every table.

The salted fish and chicken fried rice. A must order!!! So fragrant! So full of unam! Not greasy at all! 

There is a whole sleuth of other things that are really good. Ohh stir fried mushrooms with beef. To die for. Great with rice. I love the different variety of mushrooms used too.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Let's preface this review by saying that I don't expect great service at Chinese restaurants. However, there is an upper limit to my patience, and Jumbo has exceeded it.

My family and I came here for my dad's birthday at my grandma's request. She's the type of lady who will complain if she doesn't get what she wants, so we gave in. The four times we visited in the last 6 months or so, we've eaten here twice, mostly because there's always a huge wait for a table...around 45 minutes or so. The other times, we elected to go somewhere else instead. Experience has been the same here both times.

Once inside, it'll be crowded and loud. If you grew up having family dinners at Chinese restaurants, you know what I'm talking about. Loud yelling everywhere, children running around while parents are shooting the shit at the table, waiters bumping into your chair, etc.

With the huge wait and crowded restaurant, you would expect great food...but you'd be wrong. The food here is merely okay (2 stars for being reasonably tasty). The fried items such as fried chicken wings, fried flounder, sweet and sour pork ribs are over fried. The other items tasted like any other Chinese restaurant in the area. The seafood items being brought to other tables -looked- good, but my family wasn't down to buy market price crab, what with the shortage recently. Portion sizes were also laughably small.

I suspect the huge wait is not for great food, but merely being a prominent restaurant in a largely residential neighborhood. Service is slow (I suspect the restaurant is understaffed to reduce expenses), and the diners even slower. In addition, service is slow thus creating a bottleneck. My family and I waited 20 minutes to even have our order taken. The upside was that our food came out fast.

Service towards us was cold at best, but mostly rude. I suspect this is because we don't speak Chinese like the other patrons (we are indeed Chinese, fyi). Part of this is language barrier, but also culture. I experience this cold treatment whenever I go to an establishment like this...I'm never surprised, but always disappointed that this still happens in this time and age. While other patrons received warm and welcoming service, we weren't even served the complimentary dessert (as we saw given to other tables).

Overall, this restaurant is your run-of-the-mill Chinese restaurant.
author: Denise C.

description: The food tastes the same as any other Chinese restaurant's. Don't wear fancy clothes, because the smell of grease will stick to it. Make reservations or you're gonna have a bad time. Service is good though.
author: Kona T.

description: I use to go to the old Jumbo all the time because my parents were friends with the previous owners. I love that they rennovated the place because the old Jumbo was a disaster in terms of ambiance. I like the look of New Jumbo however... the prices are a bit on the higher side for Chinese restaurants and the food is sub par. Every time I've come in I've tried to order Lobster with the fried thin noodles (in Chinese it's "jeen mean" ) but every time they say they're too busy to make the noodles and we have to order another kind of noodles... uhmmm... ok last time the restaurant was packed so I get it but the other times there were maybe 3 other groups. When is it okay to order the thin crispy noodles? When it just opened? When there is no one? Let me know and I'll return.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
Maybe it's because I'm deprived of good authentic chinese food, maybe because I was hungry and had just gotten off a plane... But whatever the reason, this place was phenomenal!!! 

8pm on a Thursday & it was packed, mostly with large & loud asian families. I certainly didn't expect that since its kind of hidden (Noriega & 23rd.) My mom brought here because she always drove by and wanted to try it. Glad we did. The service was alright, I don't have high expectations for chinese restaurants anymore - but they were decent. We kept it simple, ordered squab (apparently they're really popular here) some gai-lan, and a meat dish (I forgot what it was now that its been some time since I visited.) Overall, flavorful dishes that felt like home cooking. 

Will I be stopping here post travel into SFO, you bet I am!
author: Leanna S.

description: Food is fine, but the service is so bad, I raised my arm several times to show them I wanted to order something, but one of the waitress (I believe she is the boss) kept  ignoring us and being rude to my dad. I am so disappointed to this restaurant. I hope they can treat ppl fair.
author: Mantong X.

description: This place is to small and a waiter at the restaurant elbowed me and knock over my chopsticks never go here again
author: julie d.

description:
If it wasn't for the roasted squab, I wouldn't even bother giving any stars.

The food was just terrible. Everything we ordered, except for the squab, was covered with a sweet and salty gravy. It was very unappetizing. 

I would say come here and just get the squab and some rice and be done with it, but I'm concerned about what they do with the rice. We wanted to pack what little rice we had leftover along with our other leftovers, but the owner lady quickly whisked the rice bucket away. She disappeared back into the kitchen with the bucket so quickly that we didn't even get a chance to stop her. When she came back out, we said we wanted to pack the rice to go also. She said she doesn't allow that, but we can eat as much rice as we wanted if we ate it there.

Alright so... what are you gonna do with that rice? Serve it to other people?

Then jokingly, my mom said, "oh if we knew we would have eaten more rice." Then the owner lady snaps back, "you can eat as much as you want, but if you get sick then it's not my fault!"

Um, excuse me?

I hate to think about other people's chopsticks digging into a common pot of rice after it's been in their mouths, and that same rice is served to others. Ew!

I would understand if we asked for a fresh pot of rice and then decided to take it to go, but we didn't even get a refill for the rice (we had 5 people) so there really wasn't much left at all. I can't think of what they would do with the leftover rice but dump it back to serve to other people.

Service overall wasn't great anyway, except for one of the ladies who brought us soup and tea in the beginning. She was nice. The waiter that took our order kept trying to get us to order their seafood. Yeah... $32 for crab or some type of clam for $14 a pound. We were just there for lunch, dude!

Safe to say we probably wouldn't come back here unless we really, really wanted roasted squab.
author: Sara K.

description: This place are so crowded and those waiters' attitude were really really bad! I don't want to come again because their attitude.
author: Lu Y.

description: Horrible experience, food is good but service no so much.  One of our dish was way too salty so we wanted to ask the waiter for another one, but the first thing that comes out of his mouth is, "everyone else had it today and nobody else complained but you".  Enough said.
author: Kitty C.

description: This place has to many tables for a small restaurant  I have to push my chair so they can get to the booth never go to this place again
author: Jacob S.

description:
Hit or miss. Greasy (and yes, your clothes will smell like grease too). Crap service. Sometimes it takes forever to order. Other times, it takes forever to get your check. Affordable. It's loud as hell in there.
Portions are sort of skimp. Seems like most Chinese in the 'set come here for the $9 squab. I guess it's  a deal but again, they sort of skimp. Their menu is ridiculous. They couldn't just organize by veggies and proteins..They had to go "good food", "healthy soup"  , whatever. 

I do like the korean style spareribs (at a Chinese joint haha) but sometimes they give you way too many lumps of fat. 

They're pretty much Hing Lung's rivals.
author: Susy C.

description:
I've been going to this place since childhood and management has changed so many times that I've lost count. There were years when this place was good and then there were years when they weren't. 

The new management stepped up their game and this "New Jumbo" is actually good again! Yay!!

All their dishes are family style and the prices are reasonable.

Give them a try again if you haven't within the last 2 years.
author: Simon L.

description:
As we were moaning about how the food was better our previous visit, my brother pointed out that round two never lives up to expectations. Not sure I agree but it was definitely true in this case!

We ordered a lot of the same dishes as last time, given how tasty they were previously but this experience didn't quite live up to expectations. 

The beef with mushrooms, which was excellent during our last visit, was lacklustre this time. The flavor of the mushrooms just didn't come through that strongly.  They were so tasty last time! 

Braised tofu with veg came with mostly bok choy and not enough tofu. Not horrible but a bit meh. 

Peking spareribs weren't bad but the sauce was quite thick and a bit too sweet. One person also said there was too much batter. 

Salt and pepper fish fillets were ok. We got this mostly for the kids so I don't think anyone really had high expectations. 

And I can't believe I'm going to comment on the rice but here goes:  cold and ever so slightly hard. 

So sadly, this visit was a letdown!

The pea shoots were still good though.  Light and tasty!
author: Ada C.

description:
Not very good. Beef ribs sizzling plate, salt & pepper tofu, green beans with fish fillet, "famous" game hen. Beef ribs were not good, having been soaked in oil to tenderize it. Salt & Pepper tofu, supposed to have a thin crisp skin was simply soggy. The green beans were good, the accompanying fish fillet must have been a Tilapia that had been frozen too long. The "Famous" Game hen was  was an ok rendition of a small bird roasted with a soy sauce based marinade.

Service was slow to non-responsive.  

Choosing this restaurant was an act of time conservation, since the line was long to get into the great place literally next door.: "New Hing Lung Restaurant" . Next time we will know there is a good reason why the wait line is outside "New Hing Lung Restaurant" and not this disappointing joint.
author: Matsuo U.

description: Came to this restaurant for the first time for lunch. It's got a clean interior. Got squab, beef brisket, and beef, tomato, egg over rice. Good deal and has a good menu.
author: Denise C.

description:
The New Jumbo is 110% better than the old former Jumbo. After the renovation and change management, this place has made major improvements. My grandpa used to always want to go to Jumbo back in the days. He liked the huge huge portions and low prices. Grandpa is all about quantity over quality so we'd always end up there for family dinners, while I'd think in my head...."Again???" on countless occasions! The old Jumbo was what you would classify as a whole in the wall Chinese restaurant that you know is usually unclean and the service is far from stellar. Don't even mention the restrooms! Anyway, out with the old and in with the new!

Last night I had dinner with la familia (13 deep). Yes, it was grandpa's request again but thank goodness it's the New Jumbo! We ordered many dishes as follow:

Roasted squab - good but some pieces had little meat.
Steamed chicken - standard.
Mustard greens with sea cucumber - not enough sea cucumber...sliced too thinly.
Stir fry veggies with fish fillet - my favorite dish of the evening. 
Fried rice - standard, but a little greasy for my taste. 
Stir fry veggies with chinese sausage - did not eat bc I don't eat sausage, noticed it was the only dish unfinished.
Steamed tofu - OK but nothing special.
Sweet and sour fried tofu - did not try but others said was good. 
Stir fry mushrooms, veggies and fish cake - alright. 
Stir fry veggies with pork neck - OK but not enough meat.
White rice - the usual.
Chinese sweet soup for dessert - poor....sugary, flavorless...left untouched.

New Jumbo is OK, not great but good for what it was. We had a little more than enough food for our family. It was a little over $200 including tip for 12 adults and 1 kid.The service was alright. Only gripe was that one of the seemingly clean bowls brought out for us wasn't exactly clean so I must dock them on that. 

I think my grandparents are already planning to return next month. They already asked the waitress about reserving 3 large tables for our next family gathering. I guess we will be back pretty soon.
author: Liv A.

description: Quality of food is good in general. Many dishes are authentic Canto dish. I would recommend many of their chef special. However, my first experience in this restaurant was terrible due to one of mid age lady (I think she might be part of owner) as she dressed up with casual without restaurant standard uniform as other servers. At first she tried to rush our order and we called out many dishes more than 9 for 5 people and we asked  her to repeat the order because we wanted to replace or remove one dish. She first acted she was in rush not willing to repeat and then convinced us to take all. We asked 3 times from different people and she still told us all order were good to keep (one of friend said let it be). We then let her go back to kitchen but we all really thought her response to our request was way out of line and inappropriate as a server. Although most of the food came out satisfactory as they are tasted, final bill was a bit surprised that one of steam fish price was 1.5 pound more than she quoted to us. This was $30 more. We would expect her to tell us too. At the end, we had to go back to pick up credit card as it was never given back to us when the receipt was signed. We did not catch it at that moment but it was sure the card was not attached in the binder as 3 people recall it was not there. We had to drive back to pick it up after half hour later. I guess I would suggest to watch that lady and hope someone read this review and remind her how to be a waitress and be much cautious to her rude manner.
author: Alto S.

description: Nice chinese restaurant. Great tasting dishes, although portions were a little small. Very busy on weekends.
author: Roland F.

description:
If your parents are pro-Asian food, this is a great Chinese restaurant to take them to!
Very authentic and diverse choices of food, from vegetables to duck to oyster. If you ask your Asian friends who have a good knowledge of what authentic Chinese food is like, they can validate this place. Plus, the prices are not so bad.

Service-wise, I'll say the same thing like I said for San Tung, this place is average, (about 3-star or lower). They do not have a lot of staffs to accommodate a large crowd. A typical service style you would find in a Chinese restaurant....... one example, when it gets busy, or the server is having a bad day, you will see it in the way he/she serves you. 

Parking sucks during around 6:30pm to 8-ish but not as horrible as San Tung or Irving street.
author: Alex H.

description:
Legit Cantonese restaurant and good for groups. I've walked by a few times now and the restaurant always looks full of families having a good time eating together. I've been twice now and enjoyed both times and plan to come back again. I recommend going with a larger group to try more dishes. Be aware though that if you don't order at least one dish per person they may try to pressure you to order more (which you don't have to do)

Tried and liked:
Classic beef noodle chow fun
Fish with ginger and scallions (not a whole fish)
braised fish with tofu clay pot
seasonal veggies with garlic
author: Alice H.

description: The good old days are back if you know the history of this restaurant. The food is great with big portion at reasonable price.  We ordered over ten dishes, we loved everyone of them. The deco looks good and is clean even the bathroom. The menu is extensive with some delicacies. Most of the tables is for 6 or more. Even Discover card is accepted here. If you want real Chinese food at the price and portion, you really should be there.  We'll certainly come back.
author: Steve W.

description: Tasty food but anytime I see a live cockroach crawl on my table...the place deserves a 1 star rating. Had dinner here today and near the end of the dinner, a full size cockroach crawls from the lazy Susan on our table. Gross! I would take a picture of it but in not 100% sure it's dead in the napkin we tried to kill it with
author: Sophia Y.

description: Sea Cucumber Taro Clay pot....   Has zero cucumbers in it....   Rip off....   The waiter said, $14 what do you expect???   Please don't let these people rip you off, take your business elsewhere.....    Chinese restaurants are not clean, but this one is among the worst
author: anthony c.

description:
Family style is the way to go here and it feels the way a chinese restaurant aught to. We went heavier on the veggies today and left feeling stuffed but there's nothing special about the food - some of it was kinda meh, and nothing wowed, but it is what is - solid, well priced real chinese food.

We got water spinach (lots of spinach, could use bit more garlic), braised eggplant (texturally firm which is not quite what I expected), salt and pepper fish (yum), black bean spareribs (yum), orange chicken (never seen that in a real chinese restaurant...), stir fried tofu and mushrooms (yum yum), mushrooms and shredded beef (yum), pork stir fry (yum). So lots of yum, but not much uber yum; a-ok in my book.
author: Wayne N.

description: This place is a joke!  Save yourself a trip unless you want a bad tummy ache afterwards. ...not pretty!  Did I mention that customer service is horrible and don't expect to get ahold of their servers even if you try real hard! If I could give this place zero stars, I would.
author: Kris H.

description: I would like to give this place more than 4 star because the foods was very good to perfect! But they have a very big problem here ... SERVICE !!! Even though they're busy all the time, but that's not an excuse. Every time you want to make an eye contact with the server to get something you want. They'll ignore you every time like they're busy in Hell. So the good foods with bad service, it will make my mood and foods go DOWN!!! Too bad for the Chefs back there, because the servers can make it much better!
author: Weng T.

description:
This is my first time going to this restaurant so I am using Yan Yan Seafood Restaurant and Empero Taste as a reference benchmark since the prices are the same. This was on Monday, February 17, 2015 at 12PM with my mom. Typically when my mom and I got to any chinese restaurant for the first time, we will order two dishes to use as a reference point as listed below.  This restaurant had some people inside which was a good thing! ;)

The waiter was slow as they basically made the two of us share a table with another two persons who had been waiting for a small table.  The waiter only handed everyone the lunch specials menu but not the full menu.  Then the boss lady comes with one pot of tea, one pot of hot water and one small plate of spanish redskin peanuts as she did not realize there were two different tables at the big table.  Instead of offering to bring another tea, she tried to give us the hot water only and then she basically gave each of us half the peanuts.  The waiter did not know how to ask if we were ready for ordering until we had to flag him down so we ordered off the regular menu that was on printed on the take out menu that I looked at while waiting for the table.

There was complimentary free house soup which consists of dried vegetables and pork with lots of mini bones with lots of Monosodium Glutamate aka MSG in a soup sized bowl with enough for 1 refill for each person. 

1) Beef Chow Dried Chow Hor Fun or stir-fried flat wide noodles $7.50 - This dish was more expensive than either Yan Yan Seafood Restaurant and Empero Taste which were $7.00.  On the menu, it has a funny name called Old Classic Style Sir-fried Chow Hor so I asked the waiter if it was the same thing just to be certain I don't get something else all out of surprise.  It took 30 minutes for this dish to come out.  It was about 2/3rd the portion size of Yan Yan and Empero Taste.  There was not much beef.  The flavor was okay as it was cooked in lard since one can tell from the taste and how sticky it is.  The beef was heavily coated in sodium bicarbonate aka baking soda as they were basically making lower quality beef taste better than it is.  It does have what the chinese calls wok hei.

2) Mandarin/Peking Spare Ribs $7.50 which are just a type of Sweet and Sour Pork Chops, this one is listed under the "Good Food" section in the take out menu, I wonder where is the "Bad Food" section as Capital (Peking) Beautiful Meat Spare Ribs, do they have a "ugly" version as well? ;)  When this dish came out which was another 20 minutes after the #1 above, it was 1/2 the size or slightly less of Yan Yan and Empero Taste as far as portion size goes at the same price.  Instead of big pieces of pork chops which is how other places serve it, they basically fried small pieces of pork chops in batter.  The flavor of the actual pork chops was okay but the sauce was a joke as it is basically canned sweet & sour sauce since it tastes exactly like the sweet & sour sauce one would get when eating Fried Won Ton at chinese restaurants catered to caucasians and not chinese.  

So after eating, it was already 1:15PM so we were trying to flag down the waiter to get the guest check.  It took 15 minutes before the waiter even recognizes us and another 5 minutes before he brought us the guest check which was roughly $16.00.  I took out the credit card and the waiter says no credit card under $25.  Now this one is funny because other than Chinatown restaurants which has a $20 minimum, all other places in the Sunset & Richmond districts has a minimum purchase of $5-$10.

At this point, instead of paying cash, I decided to order which took another 5 minutes for the waiter to come take the order:

3) Honey Glazed Walnut Prawns $11.99 under the "Good Foods" section.  Another 20 minutes goes by and finally this comes out.  This order is basically 1/2 the size of Yan Yan and Empero Taste as I have seen other people had this at those restaurants which is about $12.50 over there.  There was exactly 12 medium sized prawns and about the same amount of half pieces in the small sized walnuts department.  The taste was not that good as the mayonnaise lack taste, the walnuts were not crunchy and seemed like it had lots of moisture in it which made it chewy.

In case you were wondering, the menu has the following sections:
(A) Appetizers, (B) Healthy Soup, (C) Preferred Dishes, (D) Chef's Specialties,
(E) Good Food, (F) Home Style Cooking, (G) Rice & Noodles, Beverage, Rice Plate.

So we had to flag them down for the new guest check and paid with credit card which took another 10 minutes.  There was no dessert which appears to be the normal these days at Chinese restaurants. Yan Yan does not provide free house soup during dinner but they always provide free marinated chicken feet for lunch and dinner with a unlimited quantity of desserts of which you can choose from 5 different options.  Empero Taste provides both free house soup & free dessert.  Service was really poor.
author: Vincent P.

description:
Parking is easy at night but the menu is older than me.
Deep Fried squab in two portions and my favorite prawns to. They've got the sauteed mussels and of course a coke too.

How did they turn out? Diew......

1)Honey Walnut Prawns - They made the prawns seem as if they dipped it in calamari batter but the inside is cooked perfectly, but they dont drench your shrimp in mayonnaise....you do that yourself, meh, didn't taste right though. felt like eating salt peppered prawns covered in mayonnaise later....cooked shrimp was right but the outcome...not so right... (-1)

2) 2x Deep Fried Squab- Perfectly glazed, and they were not bony like an anorexic duck, perfect.....now where's my coke? (+2)
This one is a must get !!!

3)Curried Crab, least it looked like curried crab. i didn't even touch it.. (+0)

4)Mussels sauteed in black bean sauce.....good enough to pass, but next time i dont want to see so many empty shells on the plate before i get my hands on it thank you... (+1)

5)Red Bean Dessert : Very water and seemed/tasted  on the lower end of warm...oi thats walking the line..but it will do for now....not loaded in beans so you can actually drink it too. (+1)
author: Eric C.

description:
Steamed rice - essential
Sweet and sour pork chops - heavenly 
Mongolian beef - really good!
The free soup they give you - meh 
Mapo tofu - good if you like tofu ^__^
Beef satay - yes a million times
Fish fillet with salt and pepper - salty but alright!! 

Servers may seem a little rude but a lot of Chinese restaurants appear that way. Judge it by the food!
author: Cynthia T.

description: Came here for parents birthday dinner menu was very colorful and had pictures food was good and plenty of street parking. Rice is not free you pay per bowl. May comeback later in the year
author: Bin M.

description:
Babe's dad heard about this place through some advertisement, and usually those places mean they're not good enough to get a decent wave of customers. Though to my surprise, they actually weren't as bad as I had expected

I don't remember all the dishes but here were some of the things we ate for the family dinner: 

Fried Squab - Very flavorful and juicy. It also packed a decent amount of meat

XO seafood fried rice - My favorite dish of the night (besides the squab). This dish also packed a lot of flavor and it has easily become one of my favorite fried rices of all time. 

Clams with Black Bean Sauce - It was average, I've definitely had better from other restaurants.  Clams were also fairly small and meatless. I'm pretty sure they made a bulk batch along with another table's order because we had some empty shells but no meat floating about at the bottom of the plate. Big bummer

Dau Miu(Snow Pea Sprouts) with Sea Cucumber - Was this even on the menu? I don't know, all I can say is that Dau Miu is one of my favorite veggies and I love it. However, I don't like sea cucumbers, so I can't speak for that. ( I don't like the mushy grossness of sea cucumbers in my mouth) 

Beef Brisket with Turnip Clay Pot - I personally wasn't a fan of it, but I think others didn't have a problem with it. 

Fried prawns in sweet and sour sauce - The sauce tasted like ketchup (but i think they need to use that as the ingredients though, I'm not sure). The dish was not bad, but I've never had it before so I can't compare. 

I think I'm missing some dishes, so maybe I'll add them when I remember what I ate.

Overall, not a bad place to have a family dinner.
author: Harriet W.

description:
This is one of those places where it's more about quantity than quality. A lot of the dishes were huge, and we had a good amount of leftovers to take home. The food in general was ok - nothing outstanding but nothing horribly awful.

Appetizer Combo - It's one of those plates with the jellyfish, pork shank, and sliced beef. I liked how they mixed pickled radishes, carrots, and cilantro with the pork shank. It was like a banh mi without the bread. The sliced beef was pretty tasty, too. I could taste the five spice used in the braising liquid, which made the beef tender and sweet. Jellyfish wasn't good, and was just bland.
