Fish Maw and Sea Cucumber Soup - Pretty good. In addition to the sweet seafood flavors, there was a good amount of Jinhua Ham that added saltiness and umami. The soup was a little too starchy, but the flavor wasn't bad. 

Braised Fish Maw and Sea Cucumber - I don't think I've ever seen so much fish maw on one plate before. There was sooo much of it piled in the middle mixed with some sea cucumber, shiitake mushrooms, and other various edible fungi. Some of the fish maw was undercooked so it was a little more rubbery. The flavor was still ok. The mushrooms and fungi helped put the seafood flavor at the forefront. 

Lobster with Supreme Broth - The lobster was cooked well. It was smooth with a firm bite but wasn't tough or too chewy. The sauce could've been seasoned better to bring out the lobster's flavor, but it was still decent. 

Stir Fried Sticky Rice (Loh Mai Fan) - I really liked that there's a lot of goodies mixed in with the rice. It was packed with dried shrimp, Chinese cured bacon, and Chinese sausage. This gave the rice a lot of highlighting flavors, but the rice itself could've been more savory. Just a little more basic seasonings like soy sauce and sugar would've made the rice that much better. 

New Jumbo works well as local neighborhood dinner spot. This will never be a place that non-locals or hipsters seek out. It's one of those restaurants that's there when you don't feel like cooking.
author: Nei N.

description:
Food 7/10
Customer Service 5/10
Comfort 5.5/10
Price Value 7/10
Overall 6/10

Overall the place is a decent chinese restaurant, a much improved version of what it was before. Ordered Roasted Pigeons and they had a limit... but then after we ordered all the other food, they offered us more to buy. Schemed. Customer Service is pretty bad though with mean waitresses. Overall a place to go if no where is opened.
author: Auden W.

description:
New Jumbo Seafood offers traditional chinese fare at a lower price than it's better known neighbor, Hing Lung

eats: beef tofu over rice (5.5) lunch special
-lots of tender beef slices with sauteed tofu
-lots of white rice, some tofu not fully cooked, edible
-not much gravy
-very fulfilling.
3.5 stars

take outs:
-good value, tasty, msg not tasted
-service ok.
-clientele all chinese
author: Victor G.

description:
I'm just chillin here right now and I have to say that either they are short handed or they are not able to handle a full house. We only have a party of five and it's been 20 mins of just waiting. No complimentary soup either. I guess that's the price for remodeling. 

We ordered 4 dishes. 

Sizzling baby beef ribs w/ black pepper - 3 star
Sautéed sliced fish balls w/ veggi's - 2.5 star
Dried fired chicken wings / plum sauce - 0 star
Spicy dry sautéed string beans -  3 star

The food was very average except for the chicken wings. The sauce they put on the wings was just too sweet and kind of had an after taste that didn't work.

Ultimately, the place was a step down from before. They tried to maximize their tables and in that made it sort of a fire hazard on a full house. Waiting 30+ mins for avg food was a big disappointment. 

I always say, try it for yourself and tell us how you felt of this establishment.
author: Tyrone L.

description:
Young pigeon is its signature dish. $10.50 each for dine in only. Limit 1 per table. Additional pigeon at $12.50 each. 

Pigeon is Juicy. Taste salty and lacking favor. Just OK. Not memorable. No big deal.

other dishes just so so. 

I will not go back.
author: Honest E.

description: Worst customer service ever.  3 times to get a menu. Kept on telling us to hold on. 20 mins later my mom had to stand in front of the waitress to get her attention.
author: Lily C.

description:
Arrived and server made no recommendations or owner lady in black showed no hospitality. 

Ordered beef broccoli, crispy half chicken was super dry. Wife requested a change from squab to lobster noodle.  Big mistake, took 40 mins and tasty. When we inquire owner stated it takes long time cook lobster....?   That is retarded as it takes less then 7 mins in boiling water.  When dish finally showed up was cold and already finished our three other dishes. We asked extra free peanuts and ignored just like our simple to cook lobster lo mein noodles. 

It took another 20 mins to get our check though we asked and ignored. They knew we were not satisfied and at over $60. I had better food and service at half the price with hot tasty dishes. 

Avoid coming here as they are interested in pushing volume and quality is equal to lowest service possible. Dishes, bowls and utensils were a strong stay away. 

I have to say the rice bowl was warm. I returned the service with $1 tip. Not because to be mean.  But so they can know poorly managed and only concern is extract money to make room for next customer.
author: Rocky S.

description:
Great food and service!! I love it! The squab are amazingly delicious (even better than the those I had back in China). We tried the sea cucumber too, which was surprisingly authentic!
You guys should definitely try the curry shrimp and crabs! My best favorite! Cant find it anywhere else in CA!

After dining there, I bring definitely bring my family back for the banquet!
author: Mingle Z.

description:
This is an okay place. Every time we eat here, we don't set forth coming to this Jumbo restaurant. Instead, we originally wanted to go to the restaurant next door. But seeing that it's crowded next door, we chose to eat here and not deal with the 20 minute wait next door. 

It's been quite a few years since I've been back here. Maybe a little over right years ago. I must say, they took care of the place and everything looks much cleaner now. When we walked in, we did notice that there were a lot of available tables. Not a full house. But that was okay because we didn't have to wait. We ordered a fee family style dishes and they weren't that bad. Not the greatest, nut not that bad. Nothing to make me have the urge to go back. If I didn't take the pictures if what we ate, I wouldn't have remember what we did eat. So nothing really spectacular. 

If you're looking for a place to eat and not have to wait, this place isn't that bad. Not the greatest, but okay.  I did like that they gave us complementary peanuts while we waited for the food to come out. When all the peanuts were gone, we asked for more and they gave it to us again.
author: Jack L.

description:
Usually once a week I take my mom to lunch or dinner. Todaywe went to
New jumbo around noon time for lunch. oh dear ! when we walk in the restaurant
was full and understaffed. we look around and we decided to sit down on my own.
we order Fried Squab, Bbq Spareribs and Pan Fried Noodles.  
It come with soup of the day.  Food was good and Fresh . 
They also have special  choice of 3 dishes and soup of the day. $21.95 
I saw people order the to go.  I am sure that will be dinner for them
author: Ming L.

description:
Waited for over 38 minutes for food and asked about our order the waiter just went to the kitchen brought out our food.  The way he placed the food on the table seemed pretty angry and very rude because we asked twice.  (It was not even busy....)
What we ordered was the three item meal; broil chicken, rock cod, and moqua in vermicelli noodles.  We added an additional order of pork and preserved veggies in rice noodle soap.  
All dishes nothing really impressed me and might not go to this place again.  My family and I have been going to this place even before the management change but have not once waited over 30 minutes for food until today.
author: Philip W.

description:
This place sucks! service sucks... food sucks... the oil they used was stale!!! unbelievable!

if you come with a group of over 5 they do an automatic service charge... which is understandable if there was any service... 

go else where for better chinese food.. oh, and btw... I wouldn't fall for their "famous" soups.... it's a total rip off!
author: Kelly H.

description:
Improvements! Fresh tastes on old favorites!

Dining atmosphere feels like a 5 star restaurant in China with the same freshness in food quality!
author: Amy C.

description:
Never again!

Dinner time on a Friday night around 6:30 was like being ounce a war zone!  Extremely loud even with acoustic ceiling tiles.  Staff was running around like chickens without heads.  They were polite, though.

Now, for the food......poor quality rice serviced cold.  Beef with Chinese broccoli was too salty and 3rd grade produce. The MN seafood in the seafood tofu clay pot was of poor quality and sparse.  The only decent dish was the deep fried pigeon was tasty and cooked right.

$31.00 + tip, no value meal here.
author: Debbie T.

description:
Let's just say it is hard to please my grandparents, but surprisingly they like it. 

First let's start with some dislikes. The vegetables that we got were light greenish, not the freshest. The dishes got stains on them plus the servers are rude (not the worst I have seen, I mean we are at a Chinese restaurant after all). 

Despite all their flaws, they do serve up some good food. Their clams were big. Their chicken was juicy (especially the skin was fried). The fried rice was not dry. 

Overall it's not bad for a Chinese restaurant. I can see them being nicer not on a busy day.
author: Pak K.

description: Pretty good Cantonese style food and best deal is their lunch combo:$23 for rice, soup, 3 entrees to share family style. Dine in only for this deal and they have a $28 credit card minimum  to charge so bring cash! Ps, it's typical not great service so go in knowing this and lowered expectations and you won't be disappointed!
author: Kudos K.

description: They were out of two appetizers that I tried to order, they didn't bring me a menu, I had to go up to the counter for it. But the food was great.
author: Penny N.

description: My family and I have been coming here in the past months. We used to go next door to New Hing Lung, because Jumbo is always full. Luckily, we know the drill and now we go around 5:30ish to get a table. The food here is flavorful and delicious. Their menu has assortment of dishes, appetizers, soups and much much more. I noticed every time we go, we would order the baked quail and BBQ spare ribs. We try to order the clams last time, but it was all sold out since it was a popular dish. We will definitely come back again for dinner.
author: Elaine C.

description: The squab is always done well, but ideally you would eat it there instead of bringing it togo. Also, would recommend the salt & pepper fried crab. Service is not bad.
author: Doug S.

description: It's a great all around meal. The crab is my highlight. Of all the crab I've eaten, this crab stands out because it has a smoky flavor to it. Also worth eating are the mushroom salad and clay pot tofu. They're great but not as good as the crab. If anything, get the crab.
author: Ian W.

description: Service is mediocre and quality of food has changed since I was last there in 2015.  Not as good as I remembered it to be and prices are pretty average.
author: JADE L.

description:
This place has a new owner and initially when they reopened the food was not that great and the place was nearly empty.  I figure the owners might have gotten a hint of that and they made some positive changes.  The food is great and the service is wonderful too.  I noticed the place is packed nowadays.  I feel bad for the place next door.  I took a peek into the Chinese Restaurant next door and boy were they empty.  I think New Jumbo attracted some their customers.  

I recommend this place.  Great for family style dinners and all.
author: Wayne W.

description: Horrible service! price on bill did not reflect that of menu for several items. We tried asking for an explanation with the staff, but they were so busy, didn't even bother to answer, altogether avoiding us. Our party just gave up, paid & left. Food was good, but after this experience i wouldnt recommend to this place to anyone.
author: Lawrence F.

description:
My first visit after having received recommendation from relatives who have tried this restaurant. Squab was apparently from overnight. Part of the dish was extremely hot and the rest cold. From the refrigerator? Appeared to be...We were the first customers for lunch today. Ribs were good. Price is fair for the overall food quality. 

Did not feel impressed at all.
author: Ed W.

description:
Ask the waitress to order food. Goes around the restaurant helping others for 5-10 mins first.

Ask for westlake soup for 8 people. Waitress says not enough and kept insisting another soup when I kept telling them I wanted westlake soup. Not their stupid melon soup. Had to order 2 orders of westlake soup 

Tried to order chinese broccoli with fish chow fun. Said their broccoli was upscale or something and had to charge extra. Ordered another vegetable instead.

Ordered white rice for everyone. She said it's by the bowl. Since when does a chinese restaurant only give one bowl of rice per person?

Finally, higher price than normal chinese restaurant, small quantities, and okay taste.

Why do so many chinese people eat here again?
author: Eric C.

description:
new owners, new remodel, clean and updated decor. friendly upbeat boss lady, nice and hospitable wait staff, family run business. 

pricing is fair, and you definitely get some good quality food. 

-the fried squab, definitely a house specialty
-the pot with the taro and sea cucumber braised in coconut...anyone who likes coconut needs to order this dish
-tea chicken (or was it chicken tea? ha) was very tasty
-spinach pot was refreshing
-fried rice was good

total bill, just around 35, not bad at all

did i mention fried squab already? and that coconut thing? go try it!
author: Long C.

description:
The new Jumbo feels like the old Jumbo. just newer interior, table and chairs.

standard chinese restaurant

however the portions are slightly smaller than before. 

i think hing lung's food quality is much better than Jumbo. 

ie. sweet and sour pork ribs. there was no meat. just tons of sauce while Hing lung's pork is more flavorable and tons of meat.

Jumbo is a just a great option for family dinners. nothing too complain about
author: Carol Y.

description:
This is an okay eatery, but not a place I would recommend to friends or family.

The service are rude and pushy, almost all of their tables are circular with 5 or 6 seats so its hard to just come in and sit with a friend. I would recommend just making a traditional meal at home than to come here.

At the end of the day, there are way too many better places for me to spend my time here. My mom's homemade meals could rival these.
author: Professional Yelper M.

description:
Very mediocre first experience. 

The place was packed when I got there so I had some hopes of it being good. Parking is easy enough but if you come during prime dinner hours you most likely will have some trouble or have to park far away. 

- Soup of the day

Probably the best thing we had all night, it was hot and flavorful and hit the spot. Strangely (but pleasantly) was still hot after our meal when we went back in for another bowl. 

- Beef spareribs w/ Bell peppers on a hot plate

Besides the small show you get with this dish with the sizzling hot plate it comes out on, the taste left something to be desired. It was overly salty and thus impossible to eat without rice. The sparerib meat is fatty by nature and it did not mesh well with the glaze that the dish had...it's like when you add beans to a dish with potatoes...it has a similar texture and makes it weird to eat. 

- Pork neck meat sauteed with onions and peppers

Bland as all heck, and one of the pricier dishes on the menu. Waiter suckered my mom into getting this before I arrived. Never, ever listen to waiters when they recommend anything, it is almost always disappointing....this is yet another example.

- Clams sauteed in black bean sauce

Clams were the smallest clams I've ever had. The meat was literally the size of my fingers we went through the dish instantly with minimal satisfaction. Taste was just right and probably the high point here. 

- Fried whole flounder

This thing took courage to eat because it came to us glistening. It was almost blinding how shiny this thing was, which meant it was drenched in oil and greasy as hell. Flounder by nature is quite bland but usually comes with a spicy black bean sauce for dipping/drizzling. This place just gives you soy sauce, which when dipped is awful. Don't know how this is even offered, as black bean sauce is not hard to make. We had to use the sauce from the clams for dipping here...until they took the dish away and we couldn't anymore. 

We also had a veggie dish that I'm not 100% sure on how to translate to English, but it was bland and lacked flavor too. 

Overall most of our dishes were either overly flavored or lacked flavor. They just couldn't seem to get it right. Service was slow and almost non-existent throughout the night,...we were mostly ignored until someone came by and took our oyster dish which we were still using. which annoyed us. We asked for our check, and they brought out some boxes for us and some dessert. only to forget our check. Wow. We had to flag her down again to get it for us and it took another 5 minutes for her to come back to pick up our money. 

Not even close to my first choice for Chinese food in the city (or even the area), I'd like to say that I won't be back but feel like I probably will some time in the future. Maybe then my opinion of this place will change.
author: Alfred D.

description:
First of all, don't even bother to order takeout by phone. They don't cook the food until you arrive at the restaurant. The food is the same as before, good to mediocre; it depends on what you order.
Also, their takeout menu is the lunch menu. They don't have the dinner menu on it.

The staff is just as rude as before.
author: Matthew T.

description:
The "New" Jumbo is crap.  The old one you had mediocre food and service, but at least you had decent portions on a budget.  The current Jumbo is no longer a seafood restaurant.  The selection is extremely limited (probably 1/3 of the old menu).  They also charge rice per bowl, and a tiny bowl at that.  Most males eat more than 1 small bowl per meal.  I hope they know that; or probably just an excuse to charge more $$$ for plain rice.  The food taste decent, but you are also paying a lot more.

In short, unless you want to eat pigeons, I would avoid this place.  So many better restaurants on that street.  One much better just right next door.  I have no interest in pigeions, so I won't be coming back here, ever.  

So sad to see a restaurant I once loved to fall so low.
author: Jason L.

description:
I came here the second time. 

The was still food. However, the services were a bit slower than the last time. 

I will still give them 5 stars for their food because I want them keep having business so I can have some authentic Cantonese cuisine =)

Fried squab, and watercress soup are my favorites
author: Evan L.

description: Ive celebrated two birthday dinners here since the last update.  So far the dishes that I still recommend is the bbq ribs.  Double that order please.  Also the lobster lo mein and there fried rices dishes are good.  The lobster is seasonal.  Other people rave about the squab.  Were not even sure what it is, a pigeon, quail...baby chicken.   Anyways, I didnt think it was all that especially if they are gonna charge an extra $1 for a lemon on the side.  Its always super crowded and the host are way too busy to take orders and tend to each ta me but thats typical of chinese resturants.
author: S F.

description:
Pretty much your usual Chinese restaurant. Food was pretty good; I'm not usually a fan of Chinese food because of all the salt and grease, but it was surprisingly pleasant here. I definitely recommend the squab and the sizzling pork ribs. 
Just a warning though: the customer service is pretty nonexistent. Fon't expect much from the impatient staff, except them rushing you to leave so they can give your table to the next diners
author: Mack W.

description:
Food is good, but I have to dock some stars for the staff, the ownership, the  restaurant layout and price.

The waitress was really pushy with their recommendations, hocking dishes that were the most expensive items on the menu and don't align with what we told them we preferred. She disappeared as we tried to decide what we want and never came back.

The owner eventually took our order. She was plain rude. We tried to be understanding since it was crowded, but it was uncalled for.

As mentioned, the place was crowded and made to feel more so by how they stacked the tables together. I ate by leaning my arm on the back of another person's chair. I wouldn't be surprised if they surpassed the capacity limit.

As for price, the portions definitely don't align with the price and not comparable to other Chinese restaurants in the area.
author: Albert L.

description: Very poor service and loud environment.  The very first words from the manager was " you have an hour a a half" before the next reservation.  And then when we were ordering, the waiter implied that we didn't order enough food and tried to push us to order more.  After that, sitting at a table next to the manager, we heard her talking rudely to the customers on the phone.  Frankly, the food was ok but such poor service and bad atmosphere really took away my appetite.  2 stars is actually overrated. Won't go back there for sure.
author: Annie L.

description:
We had a family-style dinner here with the SO and his cousins. The price wasn't super expensive or anything but I was expecting a little more for the price. Standard average fare for Chinese food. Not anywhere I'm thinking about all the time but no reason for me to hate it.

The plus that I would give them though, is that they're relatively well-decorated and clean for a Chinese restaurant in its price range.
author: Winè C.

description:
NOT recommended if you'd like courteous service. 

They're surely short handed.  Or maybe the waitress was having a bad day. We wanted end to put our name down on the wait list, and asked how long the wait might be.  The waitress simply replied "no table available, and no guests are leaving" (in Chinese).  Then left before writing down our name.   Well, I guess they have more customers than they can handle, and wouldn't mind us not coming back.
author: Purple C.

description:
Invited six of my friends for lunch.  Food was good and was not salty, my friends like it. 

We ordered:
Gailan w/oyster sauce (chinese brocoli)
Crab soup with fish mow
Sea cucumber
Steamed chicken with scallions, ginger and ginger sauce
String beans with fish and scallop sauce
Lobster e-mein
Fried rice
Bottle of red wine

Price was quite reasonable.

The only person who spoke and understood English was Daniel, the waiter.

I will definitely go back to this restaurant.
author: Sachi N.

description: New ownership. Food is good but size is lacking. Smallest walnut prawn dish ever!
author: Patrick M.

description:
Came here with a group of six.  It was nicely remodeled inside, with a clean modern feel.  The waitress was pushy and a bit rude when we were ordering food.  We asked for the seafood tofu soup and the waitress said "you don't want the stew soup? Everyone gets the stew soup".  We politely declined and said we'll stick with the tofu soup.  The waitress seemed a bit annoyed.  When we asked for fried flounder she said "we have special today, rock cod.  it's sale, only $19.99/lb.  only one piece left."  As we were deciding amongst ourselves which we wanted, she said "of course you eat live fish, when you eat fish".  We eventually stuck with the flounder.   Again, she seemed a bit annoyed.   

It felt like she was just trying to sell us the more expensive items rather than making genuine recommendations.  Minus one star.

On to the food:
HK style crispy noodles - standard
Seafood tofu soup - standard
Walnut Prawns - had better, didn't like their thick sauce and it was bit too lemony
Fried Flounder - standard
Sweet Sour Spare ribs - standard

Overall, food was decent, portions were a bit small but service needs work.

2 Stars
author: Veronica N.

description:
This is my 3rd time here, honestly the food is good. But please expect a long long wait.
We've seated here over 45min now and still nothing. If you willing to wait then you can give it a try.
The reason why we have to wait so long is because they always take the order from their vip/good customer first. Even we ask them to take order for us, they keep skipping our table.
author: Vicky M.

description:
Food: The family style included about 7 or 8 dishes (soup, quail, chicken, eggplant and beef, bok choy and fish ball broth, pork chops, lobster) and were all pretty well made. My group also ordered the coconut shrimp with walnuts, jellyfish, and fried rice. At the end of it all, they serve a red bean soup dessert that was surprisingly well made. I could differentiate the ingredients versus it tasting literally like sugar and water with 5 red beans in it. All in all, it was a very classic Chinese restaurant quality--slightly stronger than necessary in flavors. 

Cost: moderate ($158 for 12 person family-style dinner)

Environment: There were accommodations for all party sizes and because of that, the room was quite crowded. There was sometimes difficulty in getting out of the tight seating arrangement but I expect that of this kind of restaurant. Also, the place was super busy and it took some time for the waitstaff to reach our table.

If you've tried this place once, consider alternatives before settling here.
author: Anita C.

description: The squad is very delicious. We also had lobster which was more expensive than we expected. They didn't tell us the price before recommending it... Soup is good also
author: Shannon J.

description:
I came here b myself on a Monday afternoon
Wow!!! What an amazing job they've done remodeling the restaurant . I felt so welcomed (the previous owners where a bit racist due to the fact that I am a Hispanic and have a few tattoos) these new owners and staff were very friendly and welcoming. The yang chow fried rice was good(big pieces of shrimp). I will definitely be back with my family. This addition to the neighborhood has been a great one!
New jumbo seafood I welcome you to the neighborhood!!!!
author: Mario F.

description:
Quality is not so good for the price and atmosphere, The serving staff is not very welcoming and are also not attentive..they recommend the soup many times,
We order:
Spareribs with special sauce, but too salty, 
Beef stew is no good,too much carrot and beef stew so little.
Chicken with ginger & onion, no meat, bone only
Menu was disorganized , come at your own risk!!!
author: Eric W.

description:
Things have definitely changed since I've been here. First of all - new name and menu prices have changed. 

The quality of Jumbo has never been amazing - it's decent though. 

The service is so so - you either get someone attentive or you end up having to wave everyone down. Most of the time - you do have to wave someone down. 

I'm not sure what I enjoy eating about this place.. It's just more of.. A place to eat family style when you have a big group. Decent Cantonese cuisine in the Sunset.

Coming here around lunch time is usually better service though.
author: Susan Y.

description: Nothing special to talk about.  This place has changed owners so many times, it's hard to know what has been different.  Food is still the same.  Typical Chinese food and restaurant.
author: Karen L.

description: Food is actually pretty good here! My family really liked it. Did I mention that one of the waiter with the tattoo on his forearm is both respectful and gq? :D
author: Vivian L.

description:
Shocking and disturbing behavior makes me look elsewhere

Our in laws prefer Jumbo even before the management change -- food was cheap, good quantity, and tastes were what they were used to.   Even after the management change, we'd go here as the upgrades were pretty good.  But something now makes us wonder if it's worth it.   They offer 3 dish specials for lunch.  They've always included steamed rice as a complimentary gesture.   We've seen many times the laborers and workers at lunch ask for extra rice and they've always complied.   At a table next to us were three elderly ladies who ordered several dishes but when they started packing up the leftovers, the waiter rushed over to take the rice away.  When the ladies asked for him to leave the rice as they wanted to take it with them, he said it was the policy to not allow people to take the complimentary rice with them.   The owner lady then came over and shouted out rudely that people were taking too much rice, she wasn't getting her money for it, so she was going to stop it by not allowing people to take the rice with them.  The ladies kept asking well if we can't take it, what are you going to do with it.?  You're not re-serving it to others, are you?  (Highly unsanitary). The owner quickly said no but she refused to say what they did with the uneaten rice.  

The whole incident makes me wonder if these people are so greedy and uncaring that they'd risk spreading unsanitary used rice and passing it off to the next diners.  

Yeah, I know this is a average Chinese joint in the Sunset so some of these practices are probably widespread but it saddens me to think that people on a tight budget like the elderly are treated like this.   Shame on Jumbo.  So if you must go to Jumbo, I'd never order a rice dish for fear that someone else has been exposing their own coughs, germs, saliva, etc on it.  For us, we will probably start looking somewhere else.
author: Bad News S.

description:
Other than some superficial remodeling, there doesn't seem much difference between the old and the new Jumbo.  There are mirrors on one side and pictures of Chinese characters on the other.  The floors are clean and laid with Pergo type oak.  The tables are covered with a cloth and topped with a series of paper place mats.  It seems that many of the tables are meant for large groups.  We came during lunch and many of the large tables were occupied by parties of two.

The service hasn't changed.  The serving staff is not very welcoming and are also not attentive.  They seemed harried and rushed people to their tables, but then took a long time before taking food orders..  A little better organization could rectify that.

We started off with some complimentary soup that did not look appetizing, though it did have a good flavor.  It consisted of chunks of bony and fatty meat with re-hyrdrated vegetables, and some sort of nuts.  We first tried to order dry sauteed string beans, but the waitress rushed off to the kitchen and said they were out.  We then order classic style beef chow fun ($6.50), Mongolian beef ($7.50), and bitter melon beef over rice ($5.50).  When the food came out, it looked very similar with this brownish gravy.  The beef seemed the same for each of the dishes.

The chow fun had a nice flavor and had chunks of bean sprouts.  The fun was thin and not stuck together.  The bitter melon was surprisingly good as it wasn't as tart as I expected.  The Mongolian beef had lots of onions, green onions, and peppers.

The chopsticks were made of plastic and food kept slipping off.  I always preferred wooden chopsticks.  No water was served or offered and there were no spices or other condiments on the table.  The waitress noticed that we were finished eating, but just ignored us until we asked for boxes and the check.  She then placed the check outside of our reach (we were sitting in one of the big round tables).

Certainly lack of focus and caring of their customers is a trait of many restaurants like this.  They seem to prefer catering to only a certain type of clientele.  We didn't eat here much when it was the old Jumbo and unlikely to eat often at the new Jumbo.  We are still searching for the ideal value Chinese restaurant.
author: Robert J.

description: If i can give negative I would . What a ripped off ? I ordered 5 big giant clams . They came with 5 half shells . Normally 1order big giant clam ( royal mussel ) came with 2 shells n split it in half . That's how suppose to serve . And they came with 5 half shells only , with tons of clear rice noodles on bottom and the server told me that was 5 ordered . That's totally was a lie . That's maybe 2 or 2 1/2 ordered . Food was nasty n expensive with very bad service . And they automatically added the service charge in the bill of big party . That's totally against the law now . I m gonna report them . I never never will go back there again . If u smart enough then don't come here . It was my big mistake to come here to eat . If u want to go there good luck to u !
author: love I.

description: Went here last night at 5:30 pm stood in line to try to get a table.  No one was at the front desk to assist customers after 10 minutes of waiting the boss lady ask how many.  I told her party of 8, she immediately put her hands up and said "no tables".  Instead of saying sorry we are booked for tonight.  Shows you what kind of customer service this place provides.  I remember this place use to be super busy then it died down and had no busy and somehow it's back up again.  Beware Jumbo your busy will not always be good forever.  Especially with this type of attitude.
author: LC C.

description:
This was my late grandma's favorite place to eat (pre-remodel). The place is brighter and not as outdated as it used to be. I think they used to have carpet, but now have hardwood floors. I also heard the bathrooms are now both uni-sex where before there was one male and one female bathroom.

Funny story - when my sister and I were kids, I had to use the restroom soo bad. Someone was using the women's for THE longest time. My sister told me to use the mens (which there was no wait). I told her no way 'cos I would never go into the men's for whatever reason. She would say it's the same, just go, she'll be outside waiting. I still didn't want to use it. We waited and waited, then finally, the door opened and this guy runs out!! I think he was more embarrassed than we were! Ah...poor guy. Well now the problem is solved!

Anyway, came here with the grandparents and family. Requested no msg and no sodium. Food was still tasty. Ordered from the menu since it was cheaper. Got westlake soup (super yummy and my fav), sweet and sour chicken, seafood and veggies, ground pork over tofu for my toothless grandpa, white rice for my grandma, fried rice for everyone else, round eye steak with greens (very good), shrimp with candied walnuts (portion was little), fried fish...and we still got taro tapioca dessert!
author: Lori L.

description:
Came here on a Saturday around 8pm for dinner and it was packed! We had to wait about 15 min to get seated for a party of 2.  I was thinking 1) the food must be decent or 2) everyone is checking this place out since its under new management.  After eating I think it's the latter. 

We ordered 4 dishes:
Fried Squab - dine in for $8.99 which is a good deal. Take out is 12.99.  It was pretty good - very meaty with a crispy skin. Only complaint- it was a bit too oily...you can tell its straight from the fryer and plated right away. 

Clams with Blk bean sauce - dish was very bland and watery. Yuck!  Worst than the ones they serve at buffets!  The onions, pepper and ginger you see in the dish did not do anything to enhance the dish. Would not order it again.  

Salt n Pepper Spareribs - this was disappointing too. Way too much batter! And the taste was a little off - not sure what it was..a little gamey maybe? The quality of the meat however was decent. Tender and just the right amount of fat. Yes I like my meat with a little fat in it! 

Cucumbers soaked in black vinegar, garlic, chili pepper and sesame oil and topped with bits of black duck eggs.  This dish was good and refreshing. Would def order again if I come back.  However this dish don't require any cooking so they couldn't really mess it up.  

Service was slow as they were busy and pretty much non-existant. They show up to take your order and bring u the food. They never came back to check if we needed anything. I was in desparate need of an extra napkin but never got the chance to ask for one. And our dinner did not come with house soup. Boo!  But complimentary red bean dessert was served. Was also hoping they would have grand opening specials but nope!
author: Cathy M.

description:
My second time here, it took about an hour to get seated and another 40 minute wait for the food to start coming out. Let's just start by saying I only came back for the food, not the service. Make sure you call in and reserve a table before coming. We didn't and group after group that "insisted" they had made reservations (in Cantonese) to the hostess were seated before us. We even wrote down our name on the sign-in sheet and the hostess did not look at it at all when seating people...after 3 parties were seated when they came in after us, I had to verbally tell the hostess how many people was in my party. Why is there even a sign-in sheet??! I would recommend having a Cantonese speaker if you want to be able to communicate with the hostess. She will start yelling at everyone in Cantonese when it gets busy, even when she's only taking orders from guests (Maybe that's just the way she talks?). I saw a big table of 10 wait 30 minutes before the hostess acknowledged them and finally took their order. 0 stars for her.

The kitchen staff is definitely shorthanded because 75% of the tables are just waiting for their food to come out.

 For our group of 7 people we ordered:

-Crab Meat w/Fish Maw Soup: 4/5
-Crab w/Salty Egg Told: 5/5
-House Special Spareribs w/BBQ Sauce: 4/5
-Famous Deep Fried Squab: 5/5
-House Special Stir-fried Frog with Peanut: 4/5
-Honey Glazed Walnut Prawns: 1/5
-Sea Cucumber w/ Veggie & Abalone Sauce 4/5
-Stir-Fried Chinese Watercress w/ Garlic 3/5


All of the seafood tastes fresh and delicious. Service from the hostess is horrible but the waiters were nice.

The bill came out to be around $130.00 before tip.

Expect to be waiting most of the time you're here. Like another reviewer said, service is lacking when they're trying to accommodate a full house. 

Overall, 3/5 stars.
author: Kasey O.

description: The wait here is terrible, amazingly they cook the beef RAW. Overall, this restaurant is way to small which causes other people who didn't RSVP to wait from a range to 30 mins to 2 hours.
author: Jefferey L.

description:
Lousy service, don't bother.  There's a reason the lone bass in the tank looks sad...  Horrible parking conditions too.

I agree with Philip W of 07/13/14.  We waited over 20 minutes for the waitress to take our order (which never happened!)  When we asked a different waitress, she waved us off, and implied that we had to wait for the original waitress to come by.

We weren't going to take anymore of this nonsense, got up, and went next door to the other restaurant.  It was packed and a bit of a wait, but once we were seated, the service and food were A+.

Go next door if you like dim sum! 

Btw, too bad there isn't a negative star to choose from!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
I was here for dinner last night. The food was just so-so. The spare ribs were mostly fat. We also ordered the lemongrass pork neck, it was so much off from what's showed on the picture and it was really salty. 

Service was horrible, I asked the waitress to replace a new plate after I had the fried squab since it was so oily and I had bones all over the plate, she never did or even bother to look at our table. So, I just asked another waiter to replace it for me. The waitress was being really pushy and asked us to get the soup where some other big tables ordered, but we only had 4 people and the soup seemed good for 8-10. I would expect something better if they price at this level. 

They should understand how competitive it is in their area. I'd rather go to New Hing Lung which is next door where their dishes are slightly cheaper and has a wide varieties of selections. It's definitely a great place for family casual dinner or days when you don't feel like to cook.
author: bebe L.

description:
New Jumbo Seafood Restaurant used to be called "Jumbo Seafood Restaurant" and was under a different management. The restaurant before served good old fashioned Cantonese food, though the consistency of the food wasn't great. The decor was pretty old, it felt run down every time I would walk in with friends or family. 

NOW, the restaurant has been cleaned up, there is a nice modern contemporary feeling to it and it feels very welcoming. I think the use of brighter lights and certain coats of paint is what makes this restaurant look vibrant. My family and I felt very comfortable while we ate dinner and chatted while waiting for our food to come out.  I came here with my elderly folks and we ordered a variety of dishes that accommodated our Chinese food palates. Delicious!

FOOD: 
We ordered the Dry Tangerine Peel Stewed Duck soup, Deep Fried garlic chicken wings, Steamed Oysters, Braised Lamb with mushrooms, dry fried string beans and salted fish meat loaf; I know it as gee yurk bee-ang.. Food was yummy yummy in my tummy! 

SERVICE: 
The wait staff were friendly, jovial, bi-lingual; yes, they do speak English too, and accommodating to our needs. For example, food allergies and salt content.

OVERALL EXPERIENCE: 
I would definitely come back with my family and friends for dinner since the restaurant is in the comfort of my neighborhood. Parking is around the neighborhood is decent if you don't mind walking 3-4 blocks to your car. The food is well worth it. Portions weren't totally huge, but it was enough for a group of five of us. The variety of Chinese food is geared toward the local Chinese population, but also accommodates the non Chinese person as well. 

However, my only complaint would be the price of food here, it has definitely risen since the previous "Jumbo Seafood Restaurant" had their $5 specialty menu. I was used to paying for 8-10 deep fried chicken wings or a pound and a half of boiled shrimp w/ sauce for $5! Must be the sign of the times and the rent increase I guess..

Will come again to try lunch next time.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Dined here with my family here last night. Found a cockroach in salad. Very disappointed. Wont come back ever.
author: Bronte H.

description:
Sooooooooooooooooooooooooooo sad man. Miss the old jumbo so much. I had really high hopes for the reopening. It looked so nice inside. Jumbo used to be our family's go-to restaurant for bdays, holidays, graduations, etc etc celebrations. Now the staff are disorganized, food comes out so inconsistently, we finally received our rice when all the entrees were gone. We had to ask many many times about our food, then they decided to give it to the next table first...

The table behind us had zero food for like an hour. It would be acceptable if the wait was worth it, but everything was saucy but so bland or over the top salty...

:[  Best thing here are the squab. That's it. Guess my future wedding banquet will not be at Jumbo anymore. lol
author: kim w.

description:
Came here for lunch today around 1 pm and was not pleased. There were big tables open and still people had to wait in line. I know you want to save the big tables for big parties, but it was already pretty late. 

When we first walked in, we weren't greeted by anyone. Everyone there was super busy even though the restaurant seems to only have a few tables with customers. We were standing and we were asked 3 times how many people were in our party. Failed. 

Once we sat down, we looked through the menu and ordered 3 things: XO sauce seafood fried rice, Classic style beef chow fun, and Egg with beef over rice. Usually the order of events is-- get seated, tea, get your order, give you soup, then your food comes. Here? Seated, got your order, you had to ask for your own tea, food comes, you asked for your own soup. So let me review the food-- seafood fried rice was good, but definitely did not notice any XO sauce. Egg with beef over rice, not enough salt. What got us mad was the beef chow fun. My mom saw another table and noticed theirs definitely look good. She knows her beef chow fun-- the dark soy sauce tells you whether or not it's good. Ours? super light and not even the same type of chow fun. When we asked the waiter, he said, you ordered the "classic style", not the regular one. I looked at the menu and there wasn't the "regular one". When my mom walked out after paying, she had to ask the owner, she said that's the same thing, so my mom told her about our plate(you know how chinese ladies are-- complain, complain, complain). But she was right! The owner took out a $5 bill and gave it to my mom. We don't want your money lady, we just want good food! Maybe you should start making some discount cards where you can give to regulars and people that got you aware of your new restaurant. One last thing about the food, one table sat down and wanted to order appetizers. The lady asked for potstickers, waiter said sorry we don't have it. Ok, well can we have the egg roll? Waiter once again said, don't have it. If you don't have it on grand opening days, why do you put it on the menu? 

I need to talk about the service, oh boy was it a JOKE! We sat down and noticed the kitchen was very slow. The workers are so confused about everything! They never bring you soup, only when you ask. Their order of food came out all wrong! the same dish that 2 tables ordered went to the table that just ordered while the older tables had to wait for another 15 minutes. Next, they didn't know who ordered what and was running around the restaurant trying to get the right dish to the right customer. We got 3 plates put down on our table that's not ours. The owner also yelled at a waiter for bringing soap to a table! She said hes not supposed to bring any soup, his role was to set up tables and clean up tables-- but tables needed their stuff and so he offered to help. That-- he got yelled at. At some point, I wanted to walk up and help the waiters/waitresses.

I know they're new, but the place wasn't busy and already ran into so many problems! I want to like you, but I had no choice but give you 2 stars.
author: Sappho C.

description: Disappointed.... Salt and pepper pork... It was pre fried and then refried... So super dried... And too much breading. This vegetable and fish I ordered... Was okay but some of the vegetables were super bruised and old...and the fish wasn't even fresh. The beef and tofu was actually pretty good. Soo that's why I am going to give this place two stars instead of one star.
author: Kelley L.

description:
Amazing food! For a Chinese person who doesn't really enjoy eating Chinese food to say that means something. Definitely will come back again in the future! 

Have to order the squab!!! One of the best dish we had for lunch. Super moist and worth it. Didn't really try the seafood because I am not a huge fan of seafood. But I heard the seafood is amazing. 

If you really want good Chinese food, definitely give this place a try!!!
author: Rosa C.

description:
Descent Cantonese restaurant. Ask for recommendations from staff.

When we were there it was very very crowded. That certainly is a good sign.
author: John M.

description:
Lunch time 3 dishes for $20 is a steal! (Until 2 or 3pm i believe)
Quality is excellent for the price and atmosphere. Better than those 3 dishes for $20 deals at greasy spoon cafes, Unlimited Rice of course.

Service is good for chinese standards. 
 

Once you give lunch a try, you could consider coming back for dinner.
author: Dustin T.

description: Food is better than the restaurant next door with better quality and flavors but portions are slightly smaller.  I wouldn't recommend coming here when it's super busy.  Even when you finally get your table, you'll end up waiting just as long to finally eat.
author: Ronald K.

description:
BEST: Newly remodeled floors instead of carpet; the place looks fresh and new but with an old setting.

I was here before for dinner before they remodeled.  And now remodeled, I stopped by for lunch.

During the lunch, they give you an in house soup of chicken broth, chicken, large vegetables like carrots, and potatoes.

3 for $19.99 for large cuts of meat and vegetables is not a bad deal.  Ordered their Mongolian Beef, sliced Fishballs and greens, and fried pork chops.  

The waitresses were very accomodating.

Parking has no meter.  

Very tasty food. 

BAD: It looks the same as the old besides the carpeting changed to wooden flooring.  The seats and tables all seem new.  But it looks like the old setting.  Not too big a deal.
author: K G.

description:
Jumbo has returned and is much better than before!

The first thing that impressed me about this restaurant was the excellent job at renovation. Upon entering Jumbo, I actually FEEL like I'm at a newly remodeled restaurant, and I feel comfortable! Being the big germaphobe that I am, I was glad and almost relieved to see that it wasn't another one of those places where the tables are jam-packed together creating an obvious fire-hazard. It's spacious and everything including the tablecloths are brand new.

The workers here are very friendly! The place tends to get busy as expected since it's only been a few weeks since it's grand opening. But I have to say, once you've tried the food, you'll want to go back again. I've tried a couple of their dishes including the squab, sweet and sour chicken with fried banana, and a curry dish - all very tasty! It was my first time trying squab and I was pretty hesitant, but it ended up being delicious :)

My favorite has to be the sweet and sour chicken with fried banana, only because it's so unique, and I loved that they added fruit in the dish. It's worth trying if you don't mind trying new foods!

The portions are very big, definitely enough for big groups. I'm not sure how the portions compare to the Old Jumbo but I can say for sure the take-out boxes are enormous! 

I recommend this restaurant and I saw it's worth a try :)
author: Cindy S.

description: The food we chose was quite good but the place was very busy.  We had HK style chicken chow mein, chow fun, and dry braised green beans.  Alot of people were waiting so I guess its a sign that people like the food.  Service can be an issue but that's not unusual for your typical Chinese restaurants IMHO.  I would try it again, but maybe I'll go earlier to beat the rush.
author: Nit N.

description: Came for the lunch special and was disappointed that the old Jumbo was gone; I had been looking forward to oxtail. Service was fine, food was fine, prices were ok, but really nothing stood out as particularly tasty or terrible. I got the pork with eggplant and bitter melon with beef.  I will only go back if I happen to be with someone who insists on going.
author: Kris F.

description:
First time coming here since the management changed. It's not so bad...that is after you get over some of the flavors of the dishes.

My family and I came here for lunch. We ordered off of their 3 for $19.99? I think it was, menu. We ordered 6 dishes total, so two of the lunch 3for however much deal. We had Mongolian beef, dried salty prawns, salted spareribs, my parents ordered some pork in some fish stew, and beef stew, and then we had green beans with pork. Overall, the food wasn't too bad....the fish stew was super fishy though and the green bean dish was a little tasteless. I thought that the peppers and cabbages for the garnishing on the prawns and spareribs were delicious though...who would've thought? I get some salad at a Chinese restaurant. Since it was off of the lunch menu, it came with some soup and rice. The soup was very mediocre to me. Very tasteless even being filled with bok choi and the solo carrot. I drank most of it though since my family didn't want to. The rice came in a pretty big but average size pot. The scoop! though was really cute and tiny. I guess it's a way to control our portions. 

Not sure if I'd recommend this place to a friend because I can't see myself coming back for a while, but it's not such a bad place. The waitress was really nice and knew English! Not to be stereotyping/racist but usually Chinese restaurants don't have many that are able to understand let alone speak English. A plus there, and that's why I gave this place a 4 instead of 3.
author: Alex T.

description: Great food great services, probably the best Chinese seafood restaurant in the city. Definitely recommend anyone who wants to try authentic Chinese cuisine!
author: Mark Z.

description: I ate here a lot when I lived in the area and worked at WaMu down the street but the last few times tried to stop in, there were thongs of people waiting outside so I ended up going to the place next door instead. There must have been a massive influx of new Asian immigrants into the Sunset District in the last few years because I thought I knew everyone in the Sunset and I did not see one familiar face this time. This place is under new management and seems to cater to big groups of mostly Cantonese-speaking extended families. The menu is intimidating and confusing to those who have not been to Hong Kong or Guangzhou where the decor, ambiance and service at an eatery has no correlation with the prices they charge. This place is pricey despite the crowded, loud, no-frills, bright fluorescent light, third world atmosphere but it still attracts big crowds because they offer value for those familiar with the more expensive Cantonese delicacies like braised abalone with goose web feet, squab, sea cucumber, Geo Duck Clam and big earthen crocks of traditional double-steamed herbal tonic soups simmered for hours from exotic things like freshly-slaughtered sea turtle, Cordyceps & Conch that are supposed to heal all that ails you. Each one of these ala-carte dishes has a price tag of $15 to $38. Most of their live fish & seafood is priced by the pound and prices fluctuate seasonally. It is killed to order in true Cantonese-style, so a single steamed fish dish may run as high as $300. So if you are looking for cheap Chinese food, this is definitely not the place and if you think Chinese food is cheap, think again. The clientele here seems to consist mainly of newly-minted, multi-millionaires from China who recently bought their way into the U.S so dropping a few hundred or even a thousand U.S dollars on dinner every night is no object as long as the restaurant has enough dishes to keep it interesting. The management seems to have been so spoiled by these cash-paying, big-spending hordes that they treat those of us who order under $50 worth of food and try to pay with a credit card like red-headed step-children. The lady at the front actually told me their new credit card machine only accepts the new credit cards with a chip in it and since my card does not have a chip in it, I would need to pay cash. I used to sell merchant credit card accounts and I had never heard of this before so I decided to call VISA and found out she was full of shit and most likely,this was a ploy to keep the profits off the books. Needless to say, it backfired on her because I gave her all the cash I had and I was actually short a buck.
author: John T.

description: Been back for a second try. Lunch for 3 w/ 3 dishes all under $25. Can't beat it. Tasty dishes, service is attentive. Had some to bring home to snack. Had stir fried greens, preserved Pork in clay pot & Cod w/ corn egg topping. I'll be back if I'm in the Sunset.
author: Stevie C.

description:
This is my first time at Jumbo ever since maybe 2 years ago.

They have a nice decor, even though it still reminded me of the OLD Jumbo,
it felt like a whole new place. The food was great, I usually get all the fried stuff.
Quality was on par with my taste and the service was elegant.

In other words, the new Jumbo definitely beats the old Jumbo in many ways.
Just try it for yourself, you'll be inpressed.
author: John L.

description: Simply put...not worth your money coming here.  I wanted to try this place -- came here for dinner over the weekend, and it was VERY disappointing -- service, food, parking -- u name it.  Menu was disorganized - you can tell a non-speaking English person created it -- it made no sense at all.  I'm Chinese and I couldn't make out what they served!  Their menu was all over the place -- not even sure what region of China/Hong Kong/Asia cuisine they specialized in.  Don't say I didn't warn you...come at your own risk!!!
author: Athena C.

description: This place is way better than the old jumbo. The decor gives the restaurant a more modern Chinese restaurant look and the food is way more appealing. The chefs at the restaurant actually use fresh ingredients and takes their time to prepare. Food was delicious especially their squab. We ordered a variety of different exotic dishes and they were all surprisingly good! What earned them the 5 stars is the customer service. This isn't your typical Chinese restaurant where the waiters don't give a shit about you. Here they actually make sure you're happy with your stay with them. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Terry K.

description: We had out of the country visitors, family and friends visiting us. We hadn't been here since the new owner and management. Well, we were very disappointed and hated it immensely and will not return for any reason in the future. The food was pricey and being native chinese born native San Franciscan we most certain know whats good and not. This was NOT!! The service is very poor and the servers were not attentive and seem to hate their jobs. The only thing that we might give praise is that the new remodel is definitely all that it has going for it. But we were all still eating close to the restaurant closing time. Luckily for us, we were at the end of our meal and just sitting, and chatting. I couldnt' believe what happened next before our eyes the kitchen help were hauling large smelling, dripping garbage through the middle of restaurant to be placed on curbside. You would think any restaurant owner that they do this after restaurant hours because nobody in the right mind want to see what's in the kitchen being taken out if just down right tasteless.
author: J H.

description:
Food is very good catonese.  fresh and lightly seasoned, it is very enjoyable.

Service can be improved.  It would helped if you spoke Cantonese.
author: Bill L.

description: Just had dinner last night 8/28/2013 The takeout here is pretty good, it helps if you can speak cantonese..We got there about 6pm, the service was pretty good about 6:35pm the place was pretty full...For the area this place is pretty good it's close to home for me so parking isn't a issue but i can see it being a issue lolz... The new jumbo is wayyyyyyy better then the old jumbo
author: jonathan h.

description: Came here with some friends over the summer. We came about an hour before closing, so there was no wait. I can't remember exactly what we got, but we definitely tried the squab and some sort of beef rib dish. SOOO good. AND they had complimentary peanuts! We also had the mung bean dessert. Pretty standard, but I love it anyway!
author: Laura H.

description: This place is terrible when it comes to customer service and waiting for your table. They always have tables reserved which are always empty. It gets crowded easily so I would write my name on the sign in sheet. The problem is they don't follow the order and table only people who has more people in their group. After a half hour wait, being on the top of the list, without even a word from them letting me know of I'll even get a seat, I left. I've had it here, I could have gone to any other restaurant in the area and gotten a seat and food on the table with the time it took waiting to be seated there. Don't go here if you expect to get a quick table and food. And this happened to me on multiple occasions!! As I was walking out I noticed the reserved seats which has been there longer than I had, still empty, just as their customer service. Their food is at best average and not worth the long wait. Save yourself some money and majority of your time by going somewhere else..
author: Chris K.

description: While the food here isn't bad the service needs improvement. They constantly need reminders for napkins or beverage needs. And not to mention rude and pushy when it comes to ordering. I gave this place 2 chances but don't plan on coming back.
author: Peachie Y.

description:
First of all, I do agree that they did a good job in remodeling the restaurant. It is clean and updated. When we arrived on a Friday evening around 6 pm only to find 4 tables of people. My wife thought the restaurant would be busier in about a 1/2 hour. The waite staff seem be be slowly bringing out food. The person that appeared to be the owner of the restaurant seemed to be just standing around. Took 10 minutes for someone to take our order. Around this time, a guy with two small children was seated next to our table. The owner seemed to "spring alive". She quickly gave him a menu and food was on his table in no time. Obviously he knew the owner.... 

The prices seem to be a bit on the high side. We ordered shrimp with scallops with greens... tasteless... jelly fish appetizer was good. Clam and black bean sauce seem to have more empty clam shells than meat. Perhaps I was not looking hard enough. Sweet tapioca drink for dessert. Heavy on the corn starch. Could have stood a spoon in the middle of the bowl. 

Bottom Line: Great place to go if you like to pay high prices for mediocre food and to check out the great model job. As we left the restaurant, we noiced the Chinese restaurant next door was full of diners. Wonder why....
author: M N.

description: Neighborhood place our families frequent.  Food is okay.
author: Joshua L.

description: After the change in ownership, I found myself to enjoy Jumbo more than ever. You must try out their Mongolian beef and the roasted quails! It's also a great spot to get some cheap lunch boxes.
author: Giana F.

description: The fried pigeons and red bean were good. The rest of the others dishes were bad. The  fried thin fish wasn't fresh.   The steam tofu with mince pork and mushroom taste awful. The mince pork wasn't fresh and I didn't see any mushroom.   The lobster with noodle didn't have much flavor. The walnut shrimp was so-so. With soup, total bill was $140 for unfresh food with lots of MSG.  Definitely not coming back here. Bathroom was surprisingly descent for a Chinese restaurant.
author: Dorris D.

description: Some are good some are bad, very disappointed at the steam fish, they served dead fish.....and the boss claimed it is fresh, never order the fish!!
author: Amy L.

description: It seems like this restaurant is becoming more mature since it has been opening for a while now. I had great experience here last night. The owner was so friendly and sassy. She was great.  Food was great. I ordered the feud squab and Yan chow fried rice. I loved both of the dishes.
author: Michael C.

description:
This place probably started new ownership about 2 years ago.  Since we saw that grand opening sign, we'd been going there a lot.  The food was great and very authentic Chinese and varied.  The lunch is particularly awesome with the choices and the bargain price of $21 with 3 entrees, a nice soup and free rice.  I would've given it 5 stars before.

Sadly, we've seen the waiter/waitresses' attitude/service quickly deteriorate about a year after its opening.  It was probably because they got so busy with the ever increasing business that the servers became very grumpy.  That bothered us but we continued to go for another year or so because the food was good and prices were reasonable.  

The last time we went there was two months ago and we decided not to go back.  We brought some friends for dinner and the waitress was grumpy and rude (as she had been for a while) and kept selling us the $30 expensive soups.  That wasn't the first time we saw the waitresses doing that when we had friends with us.  They probably thought we couldn't say no when we're entertaining friends as it'd look like we're being stingy.  That time I decided to refuse all those rip-off expensive soups the waitress proposed one after another.  I told her it's too much for a soup and she proposed another and another--I couldn't believe it.  And she was very grumpy.  In the end, the dinner cost $150 for 7 people (including a few kids), but we once or twice had a table for 8 and it used to cost just about $100.  Even though $150 was not excessive, their dinner entrees had certainly shrunk in size (and quality) and the service had become unbearable.

The other reason I decided to stop going there is because I suspect the restaurant has a cockroach problem.  When I was there once getting a lunch take-out order, I overheard the owner saying to the waitresses that they had to do something to "control/stop/prevent" (that's my best translation from what they said in Cantonese) cockroaches that night...
author: Linda A.

description: the waitress was so rude and made us wait for over half an hour because she hadn't given us a number. we also had to wait a long time to get someone to take our order since everyone just ignored us.
author: Kristina H.

description: Food tastes like shit, service sucks shit, and it smells like horse shit. Do not come to this place unless you wanna just throw money away. The retarded waiters and waitress are lazy as fuck annndddddddddd smell like horse shit as well.
author: Chris B.

description: Not really a big fan of this place, but still worth three stars.  They have a very limited selections of dishes on their menu and the prices are expensive compared to the old Jumbo or any typical Chinese restaurant. The proportions are kind of small in my opinion.  The wait here can be long during dinner times. The pro about this place is that if you like quails they make good ones and the newly remodel interior. Nothing really makes this place stand out.
author: Lucy C.

description: Squab was good. Everything else was ok. Service was TERRIBLE!!!!!! had to get my own forks and napkin. Asked for check 3 times. finally got the check 30 minutes later.
author: Rich L.

description: The service was great! We enjoyed the food very much. My friends and I had the honey walnut prawns, clams, squab, green beans, filet fish, and minced beef soup.  The food was much better than the previous restaurant. Whoo hoo!
author: Gina Y.

description: This is one of the Best Chinese restaurants in San Francisco, great service, fair price and a lobster w ginger and green onions that you wouldnt believe. I come here about once a week and now I get greeted by my first name. If your near Noriega street and want to enjoy a great meal stop into this place....Tell them David sent you....
author: david h.

description: Gave them a star because it wasn't allowed to give them a zero. This is mainly based on the mediocre food and the horrible service. As my group of 3 was walking in, we were semi acknowledged by a waiter playing on his phone. Reluctantly he asked how many people were dining. First impression of the decor was nice, floors were new along with mirror adorned walls and wood flooring that was creatively used as a wall base. The waiter grabbed 2 menus and sat us right next to the only other diners who were in the restaurant. All cramped up we decided to just move to a table a bit further away from the other party. Seemingly a strike one in the waiters book. He was annoyed we could all tell. We sat and looked over the old greasy menu and waited for him to come back to take our order. My group ordered a  squab, walnut shrimp, some seafood noodles, and a string bean with fish fillet dish. The squab was the first to come out, it was absolutely delicious, perfectly crispy and flavorful. The next was the walnut shrimp. That's where it all went wrong. The dish came after the kitchen bell rang, a female waitress came out and delivered out table the plate, as soon as she set it down I looked at it and automatically was disgusted. There was a long wavy hair that was mixed into the shrimp. Automatically called her back and even she seemed as if she didn't have her vision all in check as we told her there was a hair in it and she just stood there attempting to see it. When she finally did, she had a shocked and annoyed look on her face and took it back into the kitchen. My table and I were worried that she would just take it back into the kitchen, pick out the hair and bring it back so we called over the waiter who took our order to cancel the dish, he was even more annoyed.  We then asked to order another squab and he seemingly nodded, like he acknowledged our request and put the order in. Our filet and string bean stir fry dish as well as the seafood noodles came and we just about finished the dishes as we were still patiently waiting for the squab. It never came.. We asked the waiter if he did put in the order and he said no, rudely and had the nerve to say to us that we never said anything about ordering it. We then just asked for the check, he was extremely rude about it. One of the worst dining experiences I've had. Crap service, under staffed and rude. Never plan to come here again.
author: Michelle C.

description: Eat hear if you wished to be treated like BEGGARS.   That is the cold feeling you will get from their head waitress and co-owner.   For a party of 10, we order a mix of their expensive dishes and budget conscious dishes, like their Squab special.  We ordered three squabs since each squab is cut into 4 pieces  so everyone would get a quarter piece (note they are small unlike other restaurants that can cut them into 6 pcs.).  Well, the waitress/owner was not happy.  She gave us a dirty look and it went all down hill from there.  She continued to ignore us the entire evening.   When the squab came, she brought only two out of three and grunted, "I owe you one more".  The next one took 20 more minutes to come while we see other tables served with squabs.     Asked for water - looked at us and walked away.  Asked for the rice we ordered - looked at us and walked away.   We spend over $180 for a party of 10 and treated like beggars.  Who do they think they are?  The place looked like a cafeteria, tight, and not very clean.   You are not welcome unless she feels you are worthy to eat there.  I wish the restaurant next to them upgrade their food and put this Sh*t hole out of business. Then maybe she will put a fake smile back on her Sh*t face.
author: Henry L.

description: If I could give 0 stars I would. Worst customer service. Despite having made a reservation and the place being nearly empty when we walked in, the lady at the front gave us a seat nearest to the restroom. Seeing that there were so many other tables empty, we asked for a seat away from the smell of the toilet. She frowned at us and said this table was right for the number of people we had when I clearly saw many other tables of the same size. I asked persistently for a better table so I got one but I wouldn't have known this would be the start. We were waiting on one of our friends and the lady started yelling at us that we didn't have the exact number of people as we reserved. Dirty looks continued. I am never coming again to this place. Worst restaurant ever. Oh I need to mention that the moment you sit down they tell you that you need to leave by a certain time too. Fabulous much? Save your money and time. There are many restaurants around the area with better food and service.
author: Julie K.

description: Service is an alien concept at "New" Jumbo. I really miss the old Jumbo compared to this. The only plus side was we got a free bowl of salted peanuts and free tea... at the cost of a 60 minutes of our lives staring listlessly at the Jumbo employees as hope of service steadily dwindled away. We waited without even a greeting  - all they say is "Wait.  Can't you see it's busy?" in a disdainful tone that's bad even for a Chinese place.  Each of 4 waiters PLUS the manager have the bad habit of actively avoiding eye contact so that they don't have to talk to you again. Looked at the table left of us, two customers were sleeping. Looked to the right, old Asian ladies loudly complaining that it's been an hour and only one dish has come out. It's not even the chef's fault - Jumbo people are just slow and inefficient [I was so bored I began watching them and noticed that their waiters need both hands to hold one dish from kitchen to table and STILL spilling stuff... I'm used to waiters doing near-circus level balancing acts at other places]. I'm not a sucker - I made an executive decision to get out of this death trap, checked next door for another option and there was, and coaxed my overly nice family out. Ended up going to New Hing Lung and one guy [the manager] was overseeing the ground floor BY HIMSELF competently, the food began coming out within ten minutes, and my family left full and satisfied. Jumbo didn't even notice an entire family walking out on them.
author: Andre L.

description: The "old" Jumbo Seafood Restaurant was shit, the new one is delicious. The environment is refreshing clean and new. The service they offer is awesome and is not expensive. I had 9 people and our bill comes out to be less than $60. I will bring my family here next time.
author: Neal C.

description: Ive been here a couple time. Everytime I come the food is on point. When they first open service was unorganized, to me it was a typical Chinese restaurant in Chinatown. Weeks passed and improvement showed. Their dishes was very unique, never heard of thoese type of dishes in my life. I have introduce new jumbo to all my friends and family. Now I come here for my family events.
author: Raymond L.

description: thurs nite, you'd think it would be slow,  waited 40 mins to get 3 take out rice plates. dunno what's going on in the kitchen?  i was ready to walk out, as they kept saying ok, it's coming very soon. they are very unorganized & like many said waitress are slow & not well versed as waitresses. 2 caucasian guys waled in & asked about Lobsters & waitress said Lobster what? I'm guessing they have many lobster dishes. they turned around & walked out, saw them going into Hing Lung next door & they did not come back out as I sat in my car waiting for my takeout. Who's to blame about getting order wrong is beyond me. nonetheless it was incorrect, i thought shanghai noodles were thick, i got something like regular chow mein & think they forgot to add the pork that is described in the menu! Large portions & way to much oil, i hope they use transfat free oils. my stomach is starting to feel weird! i'm not sure if i can patronize them again, even instructing them to use less oil! either front end doesn't know how to take orders or the cook is a drop out!
author: david c.
